loans.name: Yanett

texts.es: Yanett es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Sumaqcha, tiene 32 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, es madre de un niño, esta muy contenta en Finca porque aprende mucho acerca de cómo llevar su familia y su negocio, le gusta porque esta progresando y desea en un futuro tener una casa propia. Ahora con este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza.
texts.en: Yanett is a member of the Señor de Sumaqcha cooperative bank.  She is 32 years old and dedicates herself to selling beauty products.  She has been a member of Finca Perú for 3 years and is the mother of one child.  She is very content in Finca because she learns a lot about how to manage her family and her business, and because she is progressing and wants, in the future, to have her own house.  She will use this current loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Camino al Éxito”, está conformado por 15 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de pan amasado, venta de abarrotes, artículos de bazar, preparación de comida rápida y costuras. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Colina, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Candy presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, inclinada hacia delante y un poco agachada. El corte de su cabello es una melena y es de color castaño claro. Además usa una polera manga corta, la cual es de color azul marino. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa nueva de adultos y niños, de acuerdo a cada temporada. Trabaja en este negocio, desde hace dos años. Sus productos los vende desde su casa.
Su horario de trabajo es durante las tardes de lunes a domingo.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y comercios, en los cuales los precios sean más baratos.
Con el crédito comprará materiales de construcción para habilitar una habitación de su casa en un local. Además invertirá en mercadería para su negocio. 
Una de sus metas es contar con una gran cantidad de mercadería, espera invertir en ropa más exclusiva. 
Candy vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 7 y 3 años de edad, su hija mayor asiste al colegio y su hija pequeña asiste al jardín infantil. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es comprar una camioneta, la cual le permitiría trasladar su mercadería, de esta manera vendería en sectores rurales o periféricos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el préstamo le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal, del cual forma parte comenta que sus integrantes son muy colaboradores y comprometidos.
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Camino al Éxito” [Road to Success]. It is made up of 15 entrepreneur who work in different areas. Among these are making bread, selling groceries, miscellaneous items, making fast food and sewing. All of them belong to the community of Colina, located in the city of Santiago.

Candy is the president of the communal bank. In the photo she is in the second row, leaning forward and a little bent over. Her hair is shoulder length and light brown. She is also wearing a navy blue t-shirt. 
 
She is a merchant, specifically she sells new clothes for adults and children, according to the season. She has been doing this for two years. She sells her products from her house. Her work schedule is afternoons Mondays through Sundays. She buys her merchandise at distributors and stores, where the prices are cheaper. With the loan, she will buy construction materials in a locale in a room in her house. She will also invest in more exclusive clothing. 

Candy lives with her husband and two daughters, aged 7 and 3. Her oldest daughter goes to high school and her youngest daughter goes to nursery school. One of her personal dreams is is to buy a pick up truck which will allow her to transport her merchandise. That way she could sell in rural or marginal areas. She is very happy and grateful for the support offered by the Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will allow her to invest in her business. 

In regards to the communal bank she belongs to, she says tha the members are very cooperative and dedicated. Colina is a community in the metropolitan area (where Santiago is the capital of Chile), located in the north of town. Right now it is the center of important investment, mainly in the area of agricultural industry, because of large installations and important businesses. These also bring a lot of jobs to the area. There are also a lot of subdivisions in the area, which contributes to the number of residents.  It also has areas with a lot of tourism, such as thermal springs and sports in the the Laguna Piedra Roja and mountain climbing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to remodel a room in the locale in her house. She will also invest in merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La señorita Nelida es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive con su abuela quien  tiene 55 años de edad. Ella se dedica al faenamiento de Chanchos y además de eso tiene un copetín al costado de una  ruta muy transitada.
Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha día a día por un mejor  porvenir y un bienestar para ella y su familia. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su copetín con gaseosas, golosinas, galletitas y demás insumos que son los que más ella vende. Está muy contenta por la ayuda que está recibiendo y le gustaría poder continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Nelida is from the city of  Santaní. She lives with her grandmother who is 55 years old. She slaughters pigs and she also has a food stall next to a very busy route.

She is described as a very hardworking and enterprising woman who fights day to day for a better future and for her own wellbeing and her family's. Her goal is to keep working and in this way keep growing as a merchant. She is asking for a loan to stock her food stall with sodas, cookies and other items that she sells the most. She is very happy with the help she is receiving and she would like to be able to keep working.

loans.use: to buy items for her food stall.

loans.name: Lucila Carlonita

texts.en: Lucila Carlonita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Lucila Carlonita has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lucila Carlonita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucila Carlonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is taking out another Kiva loan of 60,000 KES to boost her tailoring business. With the loan, she wants to purchase sewing threads, linings, needles, canvas and another sewing machine. With the previous loan she was able to expand and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of establishing a dress-making school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sewing threads, linings, needles, canvas and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Cynthia has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She is also into mineral water refilling. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cynthia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cynthia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 19 años, es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo tiene un clima cálido, hermosas playas y sus pobladores se caracteriza por tener una buena sazón para la preparación de cualquier platillo. En su tiempo libre a Jesus le gusta escuchar música y jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, también  le gusta degustar uno de sus platillos favoritos que es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. Con mucho esfuerzo Jesus logro estudiar una carrera Técnica y por ello el es Técnico Electricista.

Con mucha dedicación el trabaja como chofer de Taxi, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el dio, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy respetuoso con los clientes.

Jesús está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo y poder comprar llantas y algunos accesorios para su vehículo, de esta manera el podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado y más seguro para los clientes a los cuales ofrece sus servicio, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para poder cumplir su gran sueño:”Estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener un local de servicios de mantenimiento de vehículos”.
texts.en:
Jesus is 19 years old. He is a very hard-working and enthusiastic young man, and lives in the city of Chincha. This city is known for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sport heroes. As well, it has a warm climate, beautiful beaches, and its inhabitants are known for the good way they use seasoning in the preparation of any dish. 

In his free time Jesús likes to listen to music and play soccer with his friends and neighbors. He also likes to sample one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious "arroz chaufa" (Chinese-style fried rice). 

With much effort, Jesús managed to study for a technical career, and he is an electrical technician.  He works as a taxi driver and shows great dedication. He works around 12 hours daily, and can serve up to 20 customers in a day. He thinks his business is going well because he is very respectful to his customers.

Jesús is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to do maintenance work on his vehicle, and be able to buy tires and some accessories. This will enable him to have a vehicle that is in good condition and safer for the customers he serves. This will allow him to have greater income and continue his daily struggle to fulfill his great dream: "To study for a university degree and have a vehicle maintenance shop."

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada, tiene 49 años, es madre de 4 hijos, ella es madre soltera, desde que su esposo se fue ella ha tratado de salir adelante sola, manifiesta que sin la ayuda de Finca ella no hubiera podido, esta muy agradecida. Para Victoria Finca Perú es mas que una entidad que da préstamos, para ella son como su familia, así ella pudo salir adelante, trata de hacer todo lo que puede, se dedica a viajar a las ferias llevando ropa y zapatos, los domingos vende comida por su casa, ahora siente que su negocio ha crecido, y ahora con el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y ropa.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the Alborada communal bank. She is 49 years old and the mother of 4 children. She is a single mother; since her husband left, she has tried to get ahead by herself. She reports that without the help of FINCA, she would not have been able to do so, and she is very grateful. For Victoria, FINCA Peru is more than an entity that provides loans; for her they are like her family. In this way she has been able to get ahead, trying to do everything she can. Her business is traveling to the markets with clothing and shoes. On Sundays, she sells food from her home. Now she feels that her business has grown, and now with the loan she has requested she will invest in buying clothing and groceries.

loans.use: to buy clothing and groceries.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de 65 años, está casado,  vive con la esposa y un hijo. El con el crédito pretende comprar  las bolsas para hacer el almacigo y además ayudar con la mano de obra para realizar el almacigo, también comprar  insumos  como abonos, herbicidas, fumigaciones, El tiene pensado comprar la semilla y las bolsas para hacer el almacigó y con los insumos  poder obtener una plantación de muy buena calidad,  y así poder venderla a un excelente precio al mercado de la localidad, así poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan, 65, is married and lives with his wife and one son. With this loan he plans to buy bags to transplant coffee, to hire workers to help with transplanting the seedlings, and also to buy inputs like compost and fumigation. He wants to buy seeds and bags to make the seedlings and with the inputs he will get a very high quality planting so that he can sell at an excellent price in the local market. This will earn him more profits and give him a better quality of life and financial stability. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs for transplanting coffee plants.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia a es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada, tiene 51 años, se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y ropa, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 13 años, ella esta muy bien en Finca porque le ayudan a  tener una base para mantener un negocio próspero, casi todo lo que sabe lo pudo aprender con Finca Perú. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de ropa y útiles escolares.
texts.en: Teodosia, 51, is a member of the village bank Alboroda. This mother of three sells clothing and school supplies. She has worked with Finca Peru for 13 years, and likes it because they help her to have a basis for maintaining a prosperous business. Almost everything she knows she learned at Finca Peru. Now with this loan she will invest in the purchase of clothing and school supplies.

loans.use: to buy clothing and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada, tiene 49 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 12 años, ella en Finca ha podido formar su personalidad, los consejos de tantas promotoras le ayudaron a poder salir adelante las capacitaciones para ella son primordiales, recuerda mucho que antes ella tenia muy poco capital ahora esta muy bien las cosas le van mucho mejor, ella ha cumplido con muchos cargos en la Junta Directiva de su Banco Comunal, ahora ella es Fiscal y trata de hacer su función de la mejor manera. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Alborada" communal bank. She is 49, and the mother of two children. She sells clothing, and has been working with Finca Perú for 12 years. 

In Finca she has been able to develop her character. The advice of so many field representatives has helped her to succeed. The training is fundamental for her.  She well remembers that before, she had very little capital; now she is doing very well, and things are going much better for her.

She has carried out many responsibilities on the Board of Directors of her communal bank. Now she is treasurer, and tries to perform her role in the proper way. She will use the loan she is applying for to purchase clothing.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 63 años,  es madre de 2 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 17 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con los préstamo que le dan ella pudo incrementar su negocio, pudo mejorara la fachada de su casa, con las capacitaciones le ayudan a como hacer un buen presupuesto, y como  distribuir bien el dinero para que le pueda alcanzar para las necesidades básicas, esta muy feliz perteneciendo a la gran familia de Finca. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the village bank Amaquella. She is 63, a mother of 2 children and has been a member of Finca Peru for 17 years. She sells groceries. With the loans she has been able to increase her business and improve the facade of her home. The trainings help her to make a good budget and distribute her money well so that she can meet all of her basic needs. She's very happy to be part of the big Finca family.

Now she will use a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and drinks.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Chan Sary

texts.en:
Chan Sary, 58, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of buying fish paste and smoked fish to resell for over ten years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns approximately USD 7 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Chan Sary is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and fuel to use in her family's farming work. 

In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland for growing rice in the dry season and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger in order to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and fuel to use in her farming work.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, en este tiempo ha visto que su vida como su negocio ha mejorado mucho, el ahorro para ella tiene mucha importancia y eso lo pudo aprender en Finca, se pudo comprar una congeladora, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para 6 meses.
texts.en: Lorenza is a member of the village bank Amaqella. She is the owner of a grocery store and has seen during this time that her life and her business have improved a lot. Saving is very important to her, and she was able to learn this from Finca. She bought a freezer and now will use the loan to buy groceries for 6 months.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Мехрангез более восьми лет предоставляет услугу, она в основном занимается шитьем. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mehrangez has been sewing to order for more then eight years. She is 29 years old, married and has two children. She is taking out this loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mahmatali

texts.ru: Махматали житель района Джиликул. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его дети маленькие. Он занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 27 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений для урожая пшеницы и моркови.
texts.en: Mahmatali is a resident of Jilikul region. He is 43 years old, married and has six children. His kids are still young. Mahmatali is a farmer and has been growing crops for 27 years. He is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer for planting wheat and carrots.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Arzigul

texts.ru: Арзигул проживает в районе Джиликул. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии Арзигул работает 27 лет. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для посева картошки и кукурузы.
texts.en: Arzigul lives in the Jilikul region. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. Arzigul has a college degree in education and has been working as a teacher for 27 years. She also farms to supplement her income. Arzigul is taking out this loan to plant potatoes and corn.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and corn

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty, ella es comerciante, tiene una tienda donde vende prendas de vestir, y demás tipos de prendas de toda variedad. Ella desde muy joven se dedica en este trabajo con su madre.
En el año 2,009 empezó su propio negocio con la ayuda de su madre en el mismo salón donde se encuentra ubicado actualmente. Nos comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre está muy bien abastecida con todo tipo de prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de uniformes escolares, con lo cual podrá abastecerse, ya que está empezando la época de clases y es necesario que este abastecida para la demanda.
texts.en:
Nelly is 20 years old and single. She lives in the city of Curuguaty and is a shopkeeper. She has a store where she sells articles of clothing, including all varieties of clothing. She has been doing this work with her mother since she was very young.

In 2009 she started her own business with her mother's help in the same space where she is currently located. She tells us that she has a very good customer base because she is always well stocked with all types of clothing.

She is requesting a loan to purchase school uniforms to stock her store. This is because the school session is beginning and she needs to be stocked up to meet demand.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms.

loans.name: Sissigbe Group

texts.fr: SISSIGBE est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Emma (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Emma est mariée à un certain Pierre. Emma n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, trois restent à la charge de Emma et de son mari. Emma vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Emma mène comme activité la vente d'emballages vides, de maïs et de la farine de manioc de façon secondaire à son domicile. Emma exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Emma s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Emma sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SISSIGBE un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit reçu antérieurement a été  bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Sissigbe group is composed of four persons living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Emma (raising her hand in the photo) is 34 years old. Her husband’s name is Pierre. Emma did not attend school. The spouses have five children, some of whom are in school. Three of the children are still in the care of Emma and her husband. Emma lives together with her husband and children and, jointly with her husband, provides for various household needs. In order to support herself, Emma sells empty containers and also, as a secondary activity, corn and manioc (cassava) flour out of her home. Emma has been in this business for five years. Emma stocks up in a region of Benin. With the goal of better responding to growing customer demand and increasing her revenues, Emma, together with the other members of the Sissigbe group, is requesting her second loan from ALIDé. Their first loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy empty containers,  bags of corn and manioc flour.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 
Josephine has a shop that sells firewood by the bundle. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stock of firewood for sale.
Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of firewood for sale

loans.name: Guerrero Rosero

texts.es:
Juan es una persona tranquila, justa, muy amigable pero sobre todo responsable en su trabajo. Juan vive con sus papas en un sector cercano a San Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi.

Juan trabaja solo en la crinaza de cerdos, este negocio empezó con la compra venta de chanchos hace tres años, con Fodemi realiza su tercer crédito el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de medicina y alimentación para las chanchitas paridoras y también para mejorar la infraestructura de los corrales, este proceso de inversión ayudará a Juan a que su negocio crezca y mejoren sus ingresos económicos que a su vez ayudarán a mantener o a sustentar los gastos de su hogar.

Juan desea seguir trabajando con la crianza de animales, para que con la ganancia pueda construir una casa propia y poder formar una familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a quiet, fair, very friendly person, but above all responsible in his work. Juan lives with parents in an area near San Gabriel in Carchi province.

Juan works alone, raising pigs. He started this business three years ago, with the buying and selling of pigs. He is undertaking his third loan with Fodemi, and he will use it it to buy medicine and feed for his breeder sows, and also to improve the infrastructure of his pens. 

This investment will help Juan's business grow and his income improve, and at the same time help maintain and support his household expenses.

Juan wishes to continue raising animals, so that with his earnings he can build his own house and be able to raise a family.

loans.use: To buy medicine and feed for his breeder sows, and improve the infrastructure of his pens.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes sells cooking utensils and cassava in Mpohor near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 2 years now. She is married. Her husband is a driver and they have 6 dependents.  Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will need a loan to purchase more cooking utensils and cassava for sale. With the new profit, Agnes hope to build a shop to enable her to sell her utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and cassava for sale

loans.name: Felictas Fortunata

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 68 años, es madre de 6 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 12 años, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes y también cose prendas de vestir, ella se pudo comprar su primera maquina de coser con Finca, esta muy agradecida por todo lo que pudo aprender en la capacitaciones, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the "Amaqella" communal bank. She is 68, and the mother of six children. She has been working with Finca Perú for 12 years. 

She owns a grocery store, and also sews articles of clothing. She managed to buy her first sewing machine through Finca. She is very grateful for all she was able to learn in the training. Now she will use the loan to purchase groceries.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 26 años, es madre de un bebe, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de cochinilla y ropas, ella siempre ha trabajado, se puede dar cuenta que en este tiempo su negocio esta creciendo, ahora solo compra cochinilla, en caso de la ropa esta incrementándose su capital y ve como sus ahorros están creciendo, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para la Semana Santa.
texts.en: Elena, 26 years old and mother of one baby, is a member of the Armaqella Community Bank and has been a member of Finca Perú [Kiva field partner] for two years. She has always worked, currently selling cochineal dye and clothing, and is happy to say that her business is growing at the moment. As it is now, she is only buying cochineal. As far as clothing goes, she is building up capital and seeing her savings grow. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of clothing for the upcoming Easter holiday.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 54, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Constantino, a driver, and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Editha oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney and are paying boundary (a daily fee) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Editha is requesting a 26,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and parts for their jeepney and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Editha dreams of being able to buy another jeepney. She also dreams that her grandchildren will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

<u>Footnote:</u>
Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn. They modified the jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit

loans.name: Sissegbe Group

texts.fr: SISSEGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à la même association de décorateurs. La représentante du groupe, Hinnouho Samuel (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans. Hinnouho Samuel est marié à une marchande du nom de Christiane. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Hinnouho Samuel, pour subvenir à ses besoins, mène depuis près de treize ans mène comme activité la décoration dans sa région. Hinnouho Samuel achète ses produits pour la décoration dans une ville du Benin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitif sur le marché, Hinnouho Samuel désire améliorer sa prestation ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Hinnouho Samuel sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SISSEGBE. Les deux crédits consentis ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SISSEGBE is a group of three people who all belong to the same association of decorators.  The representative of the group, Hinnouho Samuel (pictured with his hand raised) is 33 years old.  Hinnouho Samual is married to a merchant named Christiane.  The couple has four children together, some of whom  are in school and all are dependents.

To support himself, Hinnouho Samuel has run a decorating business in the area for almost thirteen years.  Hinnouho Samuel purchases his decoration supplies at a town in Benin.

In order to expand his business and become more competitive in the market, Hinnouho Samuel wants to improve his presentation; this will enable him to grow his turnover and profits.  To accomplish this, Hinnouho Samuel is asking for a third loan through ALIDé together with the other members of the SISSEGBE group.  The two previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: To purchase hardboard, banners, tee shirts, and ink.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 40 años, es dueña de una Bodega, antes ella tenia un restaurante y ahora decidieron cambiar de negocio, ahora le esta yendo muy bien esta muy agradecida ya que le enseñaron a ahorrar, y también pudo comprarse su casa esta satisfecha con las cosas que pudo lograr. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas por mayor para la Semana Santa.
texts.en: Doris, age 40, is a member of the Amaqella Community Bank and the owner of a neighborhood grocery, though she used to run a restaurant. Now that she has decided to change businesses, things are going very well for her. She is very grateful for having been taught how to save and can now buy her own home and is satisfied with the things she can accomplish. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of beverages at wholesale to stock up for the upcoming Easter holiday.

loans.use: to buy beverages at wholesale for the Easter holiday.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina operates a chop bar where a variety of African dishes are sold. This she has done for two years. The food she serves are fufu [a starchy dumpling], banku [a local dish made from corn dough] and rice balls. She lives together with her husband and two children. Augustina uses her income to help her husband pay for their children’s school fees. Augustina will use her loan to purchase foodstuffs and ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Augustina plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Victor German

texts.es:
Victor es una persona tranquila, con un carácter fuerte y muy trabajador debido a que quiere sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. Víctor vive con su esposa y su hijo serca de San Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi.

Víctor trabaja solo en la crianza de cerdos para engorde y venta en las ferias, en este negocio le va muy bien pero tiene dificultades, es por eso que realiza su tercer crédito en Fodemi ya que va a invertir en  la ampliación de  infraestructura de las chancheras debido a que estan pequeñas, también para la compra de crias de cerdos blancos, lo cual permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.

Víctor sueña con tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y que su familia se sienta muy bien.
texts.en:
Victor is a calm person with a strong and hardworking character, as he wishes to get his family ahead and improve his quality of life. Victor lives with his wife and son near San Gabriel in Carchi Province. 

Victor works solely in raising pigs to maturity for sale at market. Things are going very well for him in this business, but he does face some difficulties. That's why he's taking out his third loan with FODEMI [Kiva field partner] in order to keep investing in the expansion of his pig pins, as they are too small now, as well as to buy some immature pigs to raise white hogs. This will allow him to increase his earnings and improve his quality of life. 

Victor's dreams include staying in good health so he can keep on working and that his family stays in good spirits.

loans.use: to upgrade his pig pins, as they are too small, as well as to buy immature white hogs.

loans.name: Teresita Group

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin. She is married with two children. Teresita has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for four years. Teresita requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Teresita hopes to expand her business. 

Teresita is the leader of this three person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Ama

texts.en: Sandra Ama operates a grocery shop in Mpohr near Takoradi. She has done this for 2 year now. She sells different kinds of soft drinks, like milk, milo (brand of malted milk), as well as sugar, biscuits and others. She is single and has 2 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children.  She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Sandra plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene dos preciosos pequeños y ambos se encuentran acudiendo al kínder, ella y su esposo se esfuerzan día a día por sacar a sus bebes adelante y hacerlos crecer con muy amor y desde luego sin que les haga falta nada. Para esto, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una mina y ella con el fin de no alejarse de su casa, ha puesto una pequeña bodega en la parte de la sala de su casa, lo que le permite tener los ingresos necesarios para su familia. Esta humilde familia vive en la ciudad Nazca, lugar reconocido por las inmensas líneas impresas en el suelo, de las cuales aún se desconoce el origen de las mismas.

Maria es una mujer que trabaja un promedio de 13 horas diarias y le pone mucha dedicación e interés a su negocio, ella siempre está atenta de que sus clientes estén satisfechos con su compra, lo que le permite que ellos puedan regresar y así efectuar siempre sus compras en su bodega. 

Con ayuda de los prestamistas Kiva, Maria desea comprar más mercadería, tales como maicena, café, servilletas, entre otros, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y desde luego incrementar la variedad de marcas en su bodega. Con este apoyo María desea incrementar sus ingresos para reinvertirlo y ampliar la bodeguita, a su vez con el transcurso del tiempo desea poder terminar de construir su casa, lo que la hará muy feliz a ella, a su esposo y a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Maria has two precious children who are both in kindergarten. She and her husband work day-to-day to make progress for their children and help them grow up with love and not lacking for anything. To that end, her husband works in a mine and, because she didn't want to be far from home, Maria put a small store in the living room of her home that allows her to earn necessary income for her family.

This humble family lives in the city of Nazca, a place known for the immense lines printed in the dirt, whose origins are still unknown. Maria works 13 hours a day, on average, and is very dedicated and interested in her work. She makes sure that her customers are happy with their purchases, so that they will return and always make their purchases in her store.

With the help of the Kiva lenders, Maria wants to buy more merchandise, things like corn flour, coffee, napkins and other things, so that she can increase her sales and the number of brands that she carries. With this support Maria will increase her income so that she can reinvest and increase the size of her small store. With time, she hopes to finish building her home, which would make her, her husband and their children very happy.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, coffee, napkins and other things.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 53, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Carlos, a carpenter and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda sells rice cake snacks in the local neighborhood. She buys glutinous rice in the market in the morning together with other raw products she needs like margarine, sugar and coconut. She prepares and cooks the snacks and sells them in the afternoon in her local neighborhood. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw products and ingredients she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Yolanda hopes to grow her business and maintain her good health in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda cooks rice and wakye for sale in Mpohor near Takoradi. Wakye is rice and beans cooked together. She serves it with gari, macaroni, meat and fish stew. Matilda has been selling wakye and rice for the past 3 years now. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children.   Matilda assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, beans, meat and fish to prepare her cooked rice and wakye for sale.  Matilda will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, meat and fish to prepare her cooked rice and wakye for sale

loans.name: Dama

texts.en: Dama is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to expand her restaurant business. With the loan, she wants to purchase chairs and tables, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and food for resale. She thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her a loan to improve her business and provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Missimahou Group

texts.fr: MISSIMAHOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe du nom de Odile (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans. Odile est mariée à un certain Kouchika. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Odile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Odile mène comme activité la vente de nattes et des céréales dans une région du Bénin. Odile s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Odile sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMAHOU un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MISSIMAHOU is a group of three people who all live in the same neighbourhood and belong to the same tontine [savings] group. The representative of the group (pictured with her hand raised) is a 45-year-old woman named Odile.  Odile is married to a man named Kouchika.  The couple has four children, all of whom are in school and dependents. 

Odile lives together with her children and husband, and shares with her husband the responsibility of providing for the household.  In order to make ends meet, Odile has been doing business selling mats and grains in a region of Benin.  Odile buys her stock in Benin.

With the idea being to better respond to the demands of her clients--growing more and more in number--Odile is asking, along with the other members of the MISSIMAHOU group, for a second loan through ALIDé so she can generate higher profits.  The previously received loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase mats and grains.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Ms. Susana is married with three children. Her children are school-aged. She is forty four years old and lives in Diwat Buenavista, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Ms. Susana sells goods in a sari-sari store (general store) to earn a living and has had this business for fourteen years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of five thousand pesos as additional capital in the business to buy additional goods for sale in her sari-sari store.

Ms. Susana has been a member of PMPC during this year. In the future, Ms. Susana hope to have big business establishments and have many branches nationwide.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sale in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jesukpego 15 Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO 15 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont membres d'un même groupe d'animation d'église. La représentante du groupe du nom de Médégnonmi Josiane (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 27 ans. Médégnonmi Josiane n'est pas encore mariée et n'a pas d'enfant. Médégnonmi Josiane vit donc seule et assures ses différents besoins grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Médégnonmi Josiane a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Médégnonmi Josiane mène comme activité la vente de papiers A4, de fournitures scolaires de riz et divers autres articles dans une ville du Benin. Médégnonmi Josiane s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigéria. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Médégnonmi Josiane sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 15, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été  bien remboursés.
texts.en: The “Jesukpego 15” group is composed of three persons belonging to the same church community group. The group’s representative, by the name of Médégnonmi Josiane (raising her hand in the photo) is 27 years of age. Médégnonmi Josiane is not yet married and does not have children. She lives alone and covers her expenses thanks to the revenues earned through her business. Médégnonmi Josiane stopped her formal education at the college level. To support herself, Médégnonmi Josiane sells copy paper, school supplies, rice and various items in a town of Benin. Médégnonmi Josiane stocks up in Benin and in Nigeria. In the goal of meeting the growing customer demand and increasing her earnings, Médégnonmi Josiane, along with the other members of the “Jesukpego 15” group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy copy paper, bags of rice and school supplies.

loans.name: Edjromahu 2 Group

texts.fr: EDJROMAHU 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe du nom de Clarice (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans. Clarice n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Clarice est mariée à un certain Yémagnissé. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Clarice vend des céréales et de "akpan" (bouillie préparée à base de l'amidon de maïs, du sucre et de lait) à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Clarice mène cette activité depuis cinq ans environs. Clarice s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Clarice désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Clarice sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EDJROMAHU 2.
texts.en:
Edjromahu 2 is a group of three people who live in the same village.  The representative of the group, Clarice (pictured with her hand raised), is 28 years old.  Clarice never attended school. Clarice is married to a man named Yémagnissé. The couple has four children, all of whom are in school and dependents.

To meet her needs, Clarice sells grains and “akpan” (porridge prepared with corn starch, sugar, and milk) from her home and in a travelling manner.  Clarice has been doing business in this way for about five years.  Clarice buys her stock in Benin.

In order to expand her business and to be more competitive in the market, Clarice hopes to grow her stock of products; this will allow her to improve her turnover and profits.  For this purpose, Clarice is asking for a second loan through ALIDé along with the other members of the Edjromahu 2 Group.

loans.use: to purchase sacs of corn, cassava flour, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 36 años que tiene dos pequeños en edad escolar, ella disfruta mucho llevarlos al campo y pasear con ellos y su esposo, el mismo que es agricultor y taxista a la vez. María es una madre de familia que siempre está pendiente de sus pequeños, no solo en su cuidado sino también en la alimentación y educación que ellos reciben. Actualmente ella y su familia viven en la ciudad de Pisco, lugar muy reconocido por sus hermosos recorridos y centros turísticos.

Para poder salir adelante, María se dedica a brindar el servicio de moto taxi a partir de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, tiempo en el que puede atender a 45 clientes en promedio. Muchos se deben preguntar como una mujer puede conducir una moto taxi y esto  se debe a que Maria conoce los lugares céntricos de la ciudad de Pisco y a su vez las rutas que debe emplear, es así como esta madre de familia se animó a incursionar en este tipo de negocio, es así como ha logrado que sus ingresos mejores y le ha ofrecido a su familia un ingreso honrado y honesto.

Actualmente ella desea poder reforzar la base de su moto taxi y también desea pintarla, para que de esta manera se vea más atractiva y ella se sienta segura de que la moto no se averiará en cualquier momento, con este apoyo, ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos porque la moto durará más y así podrá juntar para comprarse una moto nueva. Con el transcurso de los años desea darles una carrera de estudio a sus pequeños para que se conviertan en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria, 36, has two school-aged children. She loves taking them to the country and spending time with them and her husband, who is a farmer and also a taxi driver. Maria is a mother who is always devoted to her kids - not just their care, but also their nutrition and education. Currently, she and her family live in the city of Pisco, a place known for beautiful paths and resorts.

To be able to get ahead, Maria works driving a mototaxi from 7am until 9pm, during which time she serves an average of 45 customers. Many people must wonder how a woman can drive a mototaxi - Maria knows all of the areas around the city of Pisco and also the routes she should take, so she decided to take on this kind of business. This is how she has made more money and has given her family an honorable and honest income.

Currently she wants to reinforce the base of her mototaxi and also to paint it, so that it will look more attractive and she will feel more secure that the taxi will not break at any moment. With the support of this loan, she will be able to improve her income because the moto will last longer and she will be able to save enough to buy a new one. As the years pass, she wants to give her children the chance to study a career so that they can become great professionals.

loans.use: to reinforce the base of her mototaxi and paint it.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia, tiene la edad  de 36   años, está casada y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su finca, la cual está sembrada en su totalidad de café. Ella  pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha del café y un mejor rendimiento. Ella quiere generar más trabajo para su familia para obtener  la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nidia is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two children. She intends to use this loan to maximize the capacity of her farm, which is dedicated entirely to coffee. Her plan is to invest in inputs such as fertilizers, labor, and fungicides to produce a better coffee crop and a higher yield. 

She wants to provide more work for her family in order to earn a larger profit for her and her family's well-being and thus maintain a more stable livelihood. 
This is the first loan she has gotten from FUDECOSUR. She had never taken out other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan on better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs for producing coffee.

loans.name: John Juniors

texts.es:
John es un hombre de 23 años de edad que trabaja como ambulante desde los 14 años de edad, lo que le ha permitido ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar y a su vez ganar experiencia en la labor de comerciante. John es un hombre que vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Pisco, muy reconocida por el distrito de Paracas, lugar que da la bienvenida a gran cantidad de turistas con sus hermosas playas y las famosas “Islas ballestas”.

Actualmente John tiene experiencia como comerciante de prendas de vestir un aproximado de 9 años, labor que le ha permitido costear sus estudios, él ahora se encuentra independizándose poco a poco y es por eso que necesita incrementar sus ganancias, para ello ha tenido la idea de poder comprar polos, blusas, camisas, shorts, pantalones escolares, buzos, entre otras prensas.

Esta compra le permitirá ganar aun más y así poder terminar de estudiar su carrera de farmacia química, la cual es su gran meta. John es un hombre muy empeñoso que desea poder convertirse en un gran profesional y también sueña con poder crear su propio laboratorio farmacéutico.
texts.en:
John is a man of 23 years of age who has worked as a street vendor since the age of 14, which allowed him to help his parents with household expenses and, in time, to gain experience in the vending business. John lives and works in Pisco, well known for its Paracas district, a major tourist destination with its beautiful beaches and famous Ballestas Islands. 

Currently, John has some 9 years of experience as a vendor of clothing articles, a trade that has allowed him to fund his education. At the moment, he finds himself becoming more and more independent and that is why he needs to increase his profits. His plan is to buy polo shirts, blouses, button down shirts, shorts, school pants, and sweat pants, among other items. 

These purchases will allow him to earn even more and complete his studies in pharmacy, which is his ultimate goal. John is a very hard-working man who hopes to make himself into a serious profesional and dreams of someday being able to open his own pharmaceutical lab.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, blouses, button down shirts, shorts, and school pants, among other items.

loans.name: Gloire A Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GLOIRE A DIEU est formé de cinq personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante du groupe nommée Agnès, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Agnès est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Wilfrid. Le couple a trois enfants scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Agnès vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Agnès a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Il y a trois ans que Agnès mène comme activité, la vente de layettes et divers autres produits dans une ville du Bénin. Agnès s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GLOIRE A DIEU un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier  crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Gloire à Dieu group is made up of five people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Agnès, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Agnès is 41 years old and married to a man named Wilfred. The couple has three educated children, two of whom are in their care. Agnès lives with her husband and children, and she and her husband cover the various family expenses between them. Agnès left school at primary level. For the past three years she has been selling baby clothes and other items in a town in Benin. She gets her supplies in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover, Agnès is, together with the other members of the Gloire à Dieu group, requesting a second loan from Alidé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is 23 years old, a single man. In his childhood, he could not go to school because nobody was there to support him. He is a food distributor to students in schools. He sells sandwiches made of fried potatoes. This idea came to him earlier when he was working with a merchant in a big store who supported him to start the business with simple products. This business is the main and the only source supporting him and his big family. 

Adel took a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more potatoes and cook them as fried potatoes to cover the demand of his customers since this will bring more profit to him and his family's living conditions will be improved accordingly. Adel hopes to improve his business by building up capital and opening a grocery so that he will be able to increase his profit.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes for his business so he can cover the demand of his clients.

loans.name: Almoslah Group

texts.en:
The four members of the ALMOSLAH Group are mainly married women, named Kfah, Anisa, Smah and Hanan. They are 30 to 38 years of age and have one to three children each. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood in the city of Aden, Yemen. They have many clients – mostly retail shops. The whole group took out a loan of 80,000 Yemeni rials (YER).

Kfah is 38 years old and married (she stands up and holds red dress with both her hands on the right screen). She has three children; all of them are studying in primary school. She herself only studied up to the fifth grade of primary school. She is a person who distributes different items such as ladies clothes to different retail shops for resale. She reports that she has had this business for a few months. She would like to ask for financial assistance because her household expenses are continually increasing due to the needs of her growing children. So now, she is facing a financial shortage. Therefore, Kfah is asking for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to buy stock of fabrics to sell for retail shops. She hopes that the loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of fabrics to sell for retail shops

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en:
Abdulhamid is 22 years old. He is a single man and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has completed secondary school. He decided to run his own mobile accessories business in order to earn his own money and become independent. He has been in business for two years. His work is exhausting because he is open from 9 in the morning until 10 in the evening. But, thanks to this business, he has been able to lift one more responsibility off his parents' shoulders, and he can help out with the household expenses. 

With credit, Abdulhamid started out his business by opening a telecommunication shop to provide for himself. He was able to repay his debt with money he earned from the telecommunication shop. He views his work tool as mobile accessories because they are one of his assets. He now aspires to expand his small business; so, he took out a youth loan of 150,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to purchase mobiles and mobile covers for his business. One of his goals is to earn a degree and obtain two sources of income; thus affording him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase mobiles and mobile covers for his business.

loans.name: Bazl

texts.en:
Bazl is a 28-year-old single man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen.  He is always alert to needs and has worked really hard over the past three years in his small store which is located in the city. He decided to open his spice store because he noticed that there wasn't one in his area. This is one of the reasons for the success of his business. He feels proud of himself and of what he is accomplishing with his business. He devotes the whole day to this business in order to help his family. 

Currently, Bazl would like to expand his business but he does not have sufficient money to purchase more items from his suppliers. So, Bazl took out a youth loan of 200,000 Yemeni rials from AMB that will enable him to buy oils, sugar, rice, spices, cookies, soda and many other items that he needs in order to satisfy his customers' needs. Bazl is very happy because he knows that this help will allow him to continue dreaming and working hard for the sake of his family. In the future, he would like to improve his living conditions in order to get married and build a house.

loans.use: to buy oils, sugar, rice, spices, cookies, soda and many other items for his business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. His educational background is a technical diploma. He has been operating a welding workshop for four years. His aspiration for the coming years is for his business to prosper, because it is the only source of his income. He started as a worker in other welding workshop. Later, he was let go and started his own workshop. He is able to attract customers because he is professional at making windows and doors. He employs two workers to assist him in his business. 

Due to the bad situation in Yemen, he suffers financial challenge that leads to a decrease of clients in his business. So, Mohammed has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to buy iron materials in order to make windows and doors. In the future, he hopes to have a mechanic workshop so that his profit will allow him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy iron materials in order to make windows and doors for his business.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is a 30-year-old married man who has two children. They live together in Aden, Yemen. He has great aspirations to make his grocery store business a success in the next few years. He already has a number of regular customers which has improved the family's income. The business has been successful in the last years. Therefore, he is planning to expand the business. His most important dream is to continue forward with a stable business. For this reason, he would like a youth loan of 80,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, eggs, cheese, rice, sugar and mineral waters, etc., for his business. In the future, he hopes to increase the size of his shop and purchase a small vehicle to use for transporting materials for his business from the market easily.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, eggs, cheese, rice, sugar and mineral waters, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Abizeranye Group

texts.fr:
Valence fait partie du groupe Abizeranye. Il a 34 ans et il est marié, avec 4 enfants de 3 an à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Valence est agriculteur des légumes. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture des légumes.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore. Dans les prochaines années, Valence voudrait augmenter le volume des ventes en cherchant des marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Valence is a member of the Abizeranye group. He is 34 years old and married. He has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 9, two of whom are in school. Valence has completed 6 years of primary school.

Valence is a vegetable farmer. It’s his third loan cycle with ACB. He’s going to use his credit to buy seeds and to pay for labor for his vegetable farming.

His growth strategy for his business is to use better varieties of seeds. In the coming years, Valence would like to increase his sales by looking for markets. With his profits, he will pay for his children's schooling and for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor agriculture des régimes

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is a twenty-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings, one of whom is working. With his father’s help, Hadi was able to offer his family a good way of living. He started to work as a painter in 2007 on a free-lance basis and still does this. 

Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new paintings tools to be able to start his new project. This Kiva loan will allow him take on bigger projects and increase his profits by 15%. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase new paintings tools to be able to start his new project.

loans.name: Fakhry

texts.en:
Fakhry is a 23-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and living with his parents and only one working sibling. His father is working under pressure and seeking to offer them a respectable way of living. 

Unlike other people in his age, Fakhry was ready to take responsibilities and start his own business. He has been working as cellphone and recharge cards trader since 2008. In order to increase his sales and develop his business, he decided to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional cellphones and recharge cards. In the future, he plans to open his own cellphone shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional cellphones and recharge cards.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and four siblings, one of whom is working. His father is the one responsible for satisfying his family needs. Mohammad has been working at a local café since 2006.  He’s brave and was capable of improving himself. And since he is looking to carry on his education, he asks today for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay the rest of his university fees. This will allow him to carry on his studies in a proper way. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and pursue his Master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay the rest of his university fees

loans.name: Layal

texts.en: Layal is a 23-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s single, living with her parents. Her father is trying his best to offer them a suitable life. For this reason, Layal decided to start her own business in order to take some responsibilities off of her father.  She opened her own perfumes and accessories shop in 2010.  She has also been working as a private teacher for the past four years. Today, she requests a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase added products for her shop, such as perfumes and many other accessories. She notes that this will increase her sales, and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open other branches as soon as she can.

loans.use: to purchase added products for her shop, such as perfumes and many other accessories

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and four siblings, one of whom works. Hussein’s father is the one fulfilling his family's needs and responding to their demands. Since 2006, Hussein has been working in construction, specializing in floor coverings and waiting for the perfect timing to grow in this field. He works independently upon customers’ requests. Hussein is now looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new construction supplies for his work and to develop his business. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase new construction supplies

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en:
Nayef is a 27-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s putting all his effort into being able to respond to his family requests. In 1999, Nayef decided to start his own business as a builder, and has already many years of experience in this domain. His job consists of floor covering. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase added construction materials for his business. 

This loan will facilitate his business operations and will push him to take new projects. In the future, he plans to improve his business and work hard in order to serve his customers as quick as he can.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old married man. He lives in Lebanon with his wife and only child, who is still attending school. Ahmad takes care of his family and pays his child’s school fees. 

Ahmad has four years of experience in selling construction tools and Bobcats. He’s an expert in his field and knows how to deal with his customers very well. Ahmad now needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added construction tools and supplies for his business. This loan will increase his sales and augment his revenues. In the future, Ahmad plans to open his own construction equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase added construction tools and supplies for his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 22-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s engaged, and is living with her parents and three siblings.  One of them is working.  Along with her father, she contributes to the family for living expenses. Zeinab started to work as a hair dresser from her home in 2008. She has customers from all over the neighboring villages.  They’re loyal and believe in her beautiful and fashionable style. Today, she’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to buy new cosmetics and hair dressing products, which will increase her work by 30%. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics and hair dressing products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and five siblings. He has been working in cars sales for the past 6 years. At the same time, he has also worked at a local company since 2006 in order to earn a higher income and be able to better support his family. Ali is now requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new car to expand his business and be able to satisfy his customers. In the future, he plans to focus on one business and open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 26-year-old single man living in Lebanon with his parents and only sibling. In 2008, he decided to open his own aluminum shop, after having gained eleven years of experience working in the same occupation. Mohammad started his career at a very young age. He cooperates with his father, who works as a plumber, to satisfy the family's needs. Mohammad is now asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase aluminum tools and supplies needed to improve his business operations. In the future, he plans to further expand his work.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum tools and supplies needed to improve his business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 23-year-old single Lebanese man who lives with his parents and five siblings. He owns a barbershop where he welcomes customers and provides them with top quality services. With his youth loan requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will improve his shop’s decorations in order to attract the maximum number of customers and to earn superior income. In the future, he plans to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to improve his barbershop’s decorations.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 28-year-old single man living on his own. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a farmer for the past seven years. He is specialized in cultivating different types of vegetables and banana. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional farming tools and supplies. This will be his second Kiva loan and he notes that the first loan helped him achieve substantial growth in a short period. In the future, he plans to borrow more Kiva loans as he intends to further expand his business and start cultivating exotic fruits.

loans.use: to purchase additional farming tools and supplies

loans.name: Delys

texts.es: Delys de 28 años, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años, con el que sueña un futuro exitoso, por eso dispone todo su potencial productivo, con el fin de lograr que en el futuro, pueda ofrecerle las mejores condiciones de bienestar que ella pudiera.  Delis tiene una sala de bellezas, donde vende a sus clientes servicios profesionales de mejoramiento de la imagen personal, como cortes de cabello, masajes, peinados, manicure, pedicure etc. y también asesora con productos de belleza de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes, los cuales ella misma vende y generan otros ingresos, que aplica al sustento de su hogar. Delys ha salido adelante con su hijo, con el apoyo de su madre, poniéndole todo su esfuerzo a su formación y capacitación en belleza y en empresarismo, para lograr un manejo técnico apropiado de la oferta que hace. Su salón de belleza bien acondicionado,  está ubicado en la casa de su madre, quien se dedica a la misma actividad y están muy de acuerdo en lograr el bienestar de su hijo, pues Delys con su trabajo ha logrado tener una casa de su propiedad. Su meta más adelante es tener su propia academia, para generar una fuente de empleo estable y este es su propósito familiar. Su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo, que ante la demanda del mercado, se torna insuficiente para comprar productos de belleza de calidad inigualable,  que le aseguren la venta, pues sus clientes ya los conocen y eso es lo que ella ha identificado en su experiencia comercial. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará productos de belleza como tintes, champú, acondicionador, mascarilla, etc. con los cuales sorprenderá a sus clientes y garantizarán el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Delys, 28, has an 8-year-old son with whom she dreams about a successful future.  Therefore she works as hard as she can to ensure that in the future she can give him the best living conditions possible.  Delys has a beauty salon where she provides professional services for improving one's image such as hair cuts, massages, coiffure, manicure, pedicure, etc., and she also advises on beauty products, depending on each customer.  Selling the products generates an income used to help with household expenses.  Delys has been able to get ahead with her son with help from her mother.  She has dedicated much time to training and acquiring beauty skills, as well as learning about administration, so she can appropriately manage her business.

Her salon is well appointed and set up in her mother's house.  Her mother is in the same business and agrees with Delys about her son's well-being.  With her work Delys has been able to buy her own home.  Her goal for the future is to have her own academy to generate stable employment.  The greatest challenge she is up against is working capital, of which there is not enough to meet the market demand as far as buying unequaled, quality products that are sure to be sold is concerned.  She knows her customers well and has been able to determine this from her commercial experience.  

Currently, she is applying for a CrediKiva loan to buy beauty products such as hair color, shampoo, conditioner, etc., with which to surprise her customers and guarantee the success of the investment.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as hair color, shampoo, conditioner, etc.

loans.name: Bertin

texts.fr:
Bertin est un homme âgé de 42 ans. Il est marié å une employé de banque. Il n’a pas d’enfant. 
Bertin travaille comme imprimeur depuis 2004. Il vend des fournitures de bureau et fait des impressions pour tous clients à domicile. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Bertin a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des fournitures de bureau. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Bertin voudrait ouvrir une grande imprimerie. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer l’avenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bertin is 42 years old and married to a bank clerk. They have no children. 

Bertin became a printer in 2004. Working alone, he sells office supplies and makes prints for his clients from his home. He buys his merchandise in Lomé. For the time being, his main difficulty is not being able to meet customer demand.

Bertin is seeking his first loan from WAGES to stock up on office supplies. He wants to reinvest in his activity.

In the coming years, Zinsou would like to open a large printing shop. He plans to use his profits to provide for his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy office supplies for resale.

loans.name: Fausto Rodrigo

texts.es:
Fausto es una persona tranquila, responsable con su trabajo y su familia, Fausto vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Latacunga en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Fausto trabaja con un hijo en su taller de enderezada y pintura para vehículos, trabajo que les ayuda a sustentar los gastos de su hogar y darles el estudio a sus hijos, es su segundo crédito con Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de  herramientas para enderezada y pintura para los vehículos los mismos que ayudarán a dar un mejor servicio al cliente, de esta manera Fausto logrará incrementar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos.
