Fausto sueña con tener un local más grande para dar un mejor servicio al cliente y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fausto is a calm, responsible person regarding his work and family.  He lives with his wife and three children in the city of Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi.

Fausto works with one of his sons in his vehicle metal-repair and paint shop.  This work has allowed him to cover household expenses and give his children an education.  This is his second loan through Fodemi and he plans to use it to buy tools for his workshop, which will help him provide better customer service.  In this way, Fausto will be able to increase his customer base as well as his income.

Fausto would like to have a larger shop so he could provide better customer service and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tools for vehilcle metal repair and paint work.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto  de 56 años de edad es un hombre casado que genera sus ingresos, trabajando  vendiendo refrescos como cervezas y bebidas frías, de viernes a domingo y diariamente ofrece servicios de parqueo de automóviles. Su negocio lo inició a principios del año 2011, cuando entre familiares, vecinos  y amigos empezaron a jugar dominó fraternalmente y a tomar cervezas los fines de semana frente a su casa, donde hay un parqueadero y Dagoberto vigila el cuidado de sus pertenencias.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar cervezas en mayor volumen y prepararse para el próximo fin de semana que trae un día de fiesta adicional. Con esta financiación, Dagoberto obtendrá descuentos por la compra de bebidas en volumen y con ello asegura el éxito de su inversión, en tanto esta le provee de mayores utilidades que  aumentarán su capital de trabajo. Con su anterior crédito incrementó su capital de trabajo, sus utilidades y con ello su bienestar familiar, el que planea seguir aumentando.
texts.en:
Dagoberto, 56, is married and makes a living selling softdrinks and beer, Friday through Sunday.  He also works every day as a carpark attendant.  He began his business in early 2011 when family, neighbors and friends used to get together on weekends across the street from his house to play dominoes and drink a few beers.  There is a carpark there where Dagoberto is the surveillance attendant.  

Currently he is requesting a CrediKiva loan, the second through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy larger volumes of beer and prepare for the upcoming weekend which has an extra day's holiday.  Dagoberto will use the loan to obtain discounts when buying larger volumes of beverages, meaning his investment will be successful.  This will allow him to earn more profit to increase his working capital.  With the previous loan he increased his working capital, profits and family well-being, which he wants to continue increasing.

loans.use: To buy larger volumes of beer.

loans.name: Gessler Stivenson

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva Gessler compró prendas de acero, además de calzado deportivo de marca que vendió y ganó dinero. Ahora está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará cadenas, anillos, dijes y pulseras en este mismo material, para seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo, pues su clientela, que ahora son estudiantes de la universidad donde estudia  le han hecho pedidos y él quiere responderles oportunamente, para continuar ganando su clientela. El envía sus agradecimientos a Kiva porque con sus recursos de crédito,  logró aumentar el número de clientes y también su cartera de recuperación de créditos.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Gessler bought steel jewlery and name-brand sports shoes which he sold for a profit.  Now he is applying for a new CrediKiva loan to buy chains, rings, pendants and bracelets made out of the same material to continue increasing his working capital.  His customers are mainly university students where he studies, so he wants to take advantage and fill the orders and reach out to even more customers.

He is grateful to Kiva because with the loan he was able to expand his customer base and collect outstanding payments.

loans.use: To buy steel chains, rings, pendants and bracelets.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer, de 48 años de edad, comerciante, con mucho deseo de superacion. Hoy en dia se dedica a la venta de pan y ropa usada. Para ella ha sido muy dificil el llevar la carga economica de su hogar  ya que el trabajo en el cual se desempeña su esposo no le genera muchos ingresos. Lo que desea con este nuevo prestamo es comprar una paca de ropa usada exclusivamente para niños y una pequeña parte del credito lo utilizara para la compra de pan para su venta, siendo su objetivo principal, luego de que le invierta a su negocio mayores ganancias y mejores condiciones de vida para los suyos. La señora asegura que con la ayuda brindada por kiva y afodenic se la ha sido mas ligera la situacion economica de su familia.
texts.en: Sandra, 48, is a merchant who is intent on getting ahead.  She earns a living selling bread and used clothing.  It has been very difficult for her to cover household expenses since her husband's work does not generate much income.  She wants to use this new loan to buy a pack of used children's clothing as well as bread to sell.  Her main goal is to increase her earnings and improve her family's living conditions.  Sandra assures us that with the help of Kiva and Afodenic the economic situation of her family has improved.

loans.use: To buy used clothing and bread to sell.

loans.name: María Beatríz

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 57 años, se considera una mujer de caracter fuerte, estricta pero sobre todo es muy responsable en su trabajo. María vive con su esposo en Latacunga en la provincia de Cotopaxi.

María trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de vacas lecheras, negocio que les permite subsistir y sustentar gastos de la casa. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, este crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de  una ternera para criarla y que produzca leche, esta inversión permitirá a María a que su negocio incremente y por ende sus ingresos también, lo cual ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida.

María sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 57 year-old woman. She considers herself to be a woman with a strong character who is strict but above all very responsible with her work. María lives with her husband en Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi.

María works with her husband raising dairy cows, a business that allows them to survive and pay the household costs. This is the first time that she's working with Fodemi. She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of a calf to raise to produce milk. This investment will allow María's business to grow and therefore also increase her earnings. This will help her to improve her quality of life.

María dreams of improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a calf to raise to produce milk.

loans.name: Jhon Vicente

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre de 33 años, vive junto a su esposa Martha y su hijo de 7 años en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre regiones del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada en el 2007.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. 

La esposa de Jhon trabaja como empleada doméstica, y él en cambio vende ropa de puerta en puerta. A pesar de que en ocasiones trabaja hasta 10 horas al día, hay veces en las que ya no tiene clientes a quien visitar. A veces debe esperar la paga para comprar más ropa y eso hace que sus ingresos lleguen de una manera lenta. Por esta razón Jhon desea hacer un préstamo para invertir en mercadería y así poder ampliar su ruta de venta y poder tener ropa de venta mientras sus clientes a crédito le pagan.

Este es su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre KIVA y Jhon; además él recibirá capacitación para que de esta manera su crecimiento pueda ser sustentable y su dinero sea canalizado de la mejor manera. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y esperamos que con este crédito Jhon esté un poco más cerca de ese gran sueño.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 33-year old man who lives with his wife, Martha, and his 7-year old son in “Santo Domingo”, which is one of the youngest cities in Ecuador.  Currently, it constitutes itself in a link point within regions of the country.  It is a privileged area, not only for its ethnic richness, but also for its scenery.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados belongs to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recently formed in 2007.  The principal feast of Santo Domingo is celebrated with an intense movement of visitors, and a commercial and cultural exchange.

Jhon’s wife works as a domestic and he, on the other hand, sells clothing door-to-door.  Despite the fact that sometimes he works up to 10 hours per day, there are occasions when he doesn’t have any more customers to visit.  Sometimes, he must wait to be paid to purchase more clothing, and the result is that his income can be slow in coming in.  For this reason, Jhon would like to take out a loan to invest in merchandise and, in this manner, expand his selling route and be able to have clothes while his clients who buy on credit pay him.

This is his first loan with Fundación Alternativa, which is the institution that serves as an intermediary between Kiva and Jhon; in addition, he will receive training so that his growth can be sustainable and his funds channeled in a better manner.  His dream is to have his own home and we hope that, with this loan, Jhon gets a little closer to fulfilling this grand aspiration.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and increase his work route.

loans.name: Aida Clemencia

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer de 48 años de edad, ella se considera como una persona de caracter fuerte, muy estricta y muy responsable con su familia. Aida vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en Machachi que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de Latacunga.

Aida trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de vacas y venta de leche que sus vaquitas producen, este negocio es rentable debido a que trata muy bien a sus clientes, este negocio con sus ingresos ayuda a sustentar los estudios de sus hijos. Es la segund año que trabaja con Fodemi, el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de una vaca lechera que le estan ofreciendo a un buen precio y quiere aprovechar para incrementar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Aida sueña con comprarse más vacas para dedicarse a la producción de leche y distribuir a empresas grandes.
texts.en:
Aida is a 48-year old woman, who considers herself someone of strong character, very strict and very responsible with her family.  Aida lives with her husband and two children in Machachi, which can be found and hour and a half from Latacunga.

Aida works with her husband raising cows and selling milk that the cows produce.  This business is very profitable given that she treats her customers well.  This business’ income helps sustain the children’s educations.  This is the second year she works with Fodemi.  The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of a milking cow that is being offered to her at a good price, and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to grow her business and improve her standard of living.

Aida dreams of buying more cows to dedicate herself to milk production and distribute to large enterprises.

loans.use: to take advantage of buying a milking cow that is being offered to her at a good price.

loans.name: El Encanto Group

texts.es:
La señora Feliza es uno de los miembros del grupo El Encanto el cual esta integrado por 7 personas, cada una de ellas tiene una actividad economica la cual desarrollan para tener mas ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingenio la margarita uno de los principales productores de azucar de la region.

Doña Feliza tiene la edad de 66 años, solo estudio el primer grado de primaria y es viuda, ella tuvo 7 hijos los cuales ya estan casados y nos platica que desde hace mas de 8 años cuando su esposo vivia le puso pequeña lavanderia en su casa para que ganara un poco de dinero extra y ahora que su esposo fallecio ella continua trabajando en su negocio y esta muy contenta ya que su marido le dejo un buen negocio con el cual a salido a delante, con el pasar de los años su negocio ha ido creciendo y ganando clientes, ella abre todos los dias desde muy temprano, sus cleintes estan muy contentos con su trabajo ya que siempre al atenderlos les da un buen trato y su ropa siempre esta lista cuando ellos la necesitan. Doña Feliza invertira este credito en la compra de  variedad de detergentes(cloro, suavitel, jabon de barra y polvo) y dar mantenimiento a maquinaria.Ella espera que con este credito su negocio continue creciendo ya que a futuro le gustaria iniciar a hacer trabajos de tintoreria.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

mirna venta de pollo 
ramiro tienda de abarrotes 
margarita vanta de antojitos mexicanos 
sergio taxista
Juan carlos venta de hamburgesas
Rosa frutas y legumbres

este grupo agradece a la fundacion por el prestamo que le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
Feliza is one of the members of the group “El Encanto”, which is comprised of 7 people.  Each one carries out a different activity in order to generate more income and improve their standard of living.  This group is located in a sugar cane zone, only 15 minutes from the La Margarita refinery, one of the main sugar producers in the region.

Feliza is 66 years old, only studied to first grade, and is a widow.  She had 7 children who are now married, and tells us that more than 8 years ago, when her husband was still alive, she installed a small laundry in her house in order to earn a little extra money.  Now that her husband has passed away, she continues with this business and is very content that her husband left her a good business with which she has been able to get ahead.  Over time, her business has grown and gained customers.  She opens very early every day, and her customers are happy with her service since she always tends to them well and their clothes are always ready when they need them.  Feliza will invest this loan into the purchase of a variety of detergents (bleach, fabric softener, bar and powdered soap) and to maintain her machinery.  She hopes that, with this loan, she can continue to grow her business since she would also like to start a dry cleaning service.

The other members of the group are:

Mirna – poultry sales
Ramiro – general store
Margarita – sells Mexican snack foods
Sergio – taxi driver
Juan Carlos – hamburger sales
Rosa – fruit and vegetable sales

This group thanks the foundation for the loan it has granted to them.

loans.use: to buy a variety of detergents (bleach, fabric softener, bar and powdered soap) and to maintain her machinery.

loans.name: Cristina Rebeca

texts.es:
Cristina es una señorita de 26 años, se considera una mujer alegre, emprendedora y muy responsable. Cristina vive en Ambato sola.

Cristina tiene un restaurant en cual trabaja junto con su madre y una ayudante, empezó a dar este servicio de comida solo con una mesa, cinco sillas y una cocina ahora está pogresando y quiere seguir adelante debido a que los ingresos y utilidades que tiene le sirven para ayudar a sus padres y pagarse su universidad. Cristina trabaja con Fodemi cerca de un año, el crédito actual es para la compra de víveres, refrescos, frutas, carnicos, embutidos, productos enlatados, verduras para dar una buena atención al cliente con muy buena comida.

Cristina sueña con que le sigan ayudando las instituciones como Fodemi para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 26-year old woman who considers herself to be very happy, entrepreneurial and responsible.  Cristina lives alone in Ambato.

Cristina has a restaurant where she works with her mother and one helper.  She started to provide her food service with only one table, five chairs and a stove.  Now, she is progressing, and wants to continue moving forward because the income and usefulness of the business allows her to help her parents and pay for her university expenses.  Cristina has worked with Fodemi for almost one year; the current loan is for the purchase of provisions, beverages, fruits, meat, cold cuts, canned goods and vegetables, to provide a good service for her customers through excellent food.

Cristina dreams that the institutions like Fodemi continue to help her so she can continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy supplies, beverages, fruits, meat, cold cuts, canned goods, vegetables.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” sigue en funcionamiento en la Asociación Arariwa y ahora está conformado por 10 mujeres y 2 varones. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad y viven en la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  La mayoría de los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como venta de artesanía, comestibles y otros brindan servicios. 

(La persona que aparece en la fotografía levantando la mano es la socia Celinda). 

La socia Celinda tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y frutos de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Celinda es profesora y trabaja en uno de los  colegios más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica complementaria de Celinda es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergente y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Celinda requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. 

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.

Las socias Sonia  y Kelly no aparecen en la foto porque pidieron permiso a la junta del banco comunal para no estar presentes el día del desembolso.
texts.en:
The “Enterprising Women” cooperative bank continues working in the Arariwa Association, and is now comprised of 10 women and 2 men.  The majority of the members are neighbors, friends, and live in the city of Cusco.

The members are hard working and entrepreneurial people, who always seek opportunities to get ahead and to, through their daily efforts, provide a brighter future for their children.  The majority of the members dedicate themselves to different economic activities, such as handicraft sales, food, and others provide services.

(The person in the picture with her hand raised is Celinda).

Celinda is 46 years old, married, and has three children from this relationship.  She was born in the city of Quillabamba, but currently lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  Celinda is a teacher and works in one of the most popular schools in Cusco.  Her concurrent business is selling items of basic necessity such as, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, detergents and other items.  At this time, Celinda needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar.  The members are grateful and appreciate the loan granted via this means, and commit to fulfilling their payment obligations in their entirety during the established time frame.

The members Sonia and Kelly don't appear in the photograph, as they asked the cooperative bank’s management permission to be absent on the day of disbursement.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as, for example, sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Kondokpo Group

texts.fr: KONDOKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Sophiatou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Sophiatou est mariée à un certain Abiba. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sophiatou, pour subvenir à ses besoins, vend des vêtements tout cousus et des chaussures de façon secondaire dans une ville du Bénin. Sophiatou s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et  pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Sophiatou désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Sophiatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KONDOKPO. les deux crédits consentis autrefois ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: KONDOKPO is a group of three people who are friends. The group's representative, Sophiatou (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 34 years old. Sophiatou is married to a man named Abiba. The couple has two children, both in school and in their care. Sophiatou sells sewn clothing and shoes secondarily in a city in Benin in order to provide for her needs. Sophiatou stocks up in Benin. With the goal of increasing her business activity and being more competitive on the market, Sophiatou wants to increase the stock of her products, which will allow her to increase her turnover and revenue. For this reason, Sophiatou is asking for a third loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the KONDOKPO group. Their two loans granted earlier were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Abla Victorine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Abla Victorine est mariée à un certain Marc et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Abla Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Abla Victorine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Abla Victorine vend depuis sept ans, des produits vivriers (riz, maïs, etc.) et des liqueurs de façon secondaire à son domicile mais aussi par le système de distribution. Abla Victorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Abla Victorine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: DIEU EST GRAND is a group of three people. The members live in the same area in Benin. The representative of the group, Abla Victorine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 37 years old. Abla Victorine is married to a man named Marc and is a mother of three children, all in school and in the couple's care. Abla Victorine lives together with her husband and children. The couple provides for the various household expenses together. Abla Victorine stopped school at the primary level. To cope with her various expenses, Abla Victorine has sold food crops (rice, corn, etc.) and liqueurs secondarily from her home, but also through a distribution system, for seven years. Abla Victorine stocks up in a market in Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and with an eye to enlarging her business, Abla Victorine is asking for a fourth loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the group DIEU EST GRAND. This loan will be used by them to better respond to their customer's demands and to make more profits. Their previous loans were repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, rice, and liqueurs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, représentante du groupe de crédit, entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans, mariée. Elle est  vendeuses de friperie. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle  s’installa dans la ville de Goma en provenance de son village natal dans le Sud Kivu, ainsi, elle fut initié par ses pairs.  Son mari est un maitre maçon constructeur. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et la scolarisation de ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  20eme  crédit de Hekima. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses ventes sensiblement diminuent suite au déséquilibre macro économique. Ainsi elle a  décidé de réduire son montant de crédit pour ce cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  une  moitie d’un ballon de friperie.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et construire sa maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: The client, representative of the loan group, is a 48 year old, married entrepreneur. She sells used clothing. She started her business when she moved from the village where she was born in the province of South Kivu to the city of Goma, where she was introduced to the business by her peers. Her husband is a master builder. The profits from her business are used for savings, and for feeding and educating her children. However, she just obtained her 20th loan from Hekima. Over this period, this client has seen her sales decrease noticeably following the economic instability. Thus she decided to reduce the loan sum this cycle. This new loan will be used for her to stock up with half a bale of used clothing. Additionally, she wishes to see her children grow up and build her house. The client thanks Hekima for its actions in helping poor women excluding from traditional banks to achieve autonomy. One ought to mention that the client is holding her baby.

loans.use: to pay for half of a bale of used clothes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hajarah

texts.en:
Hajarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members.

She sells green bananas at the market on retail basis. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. Hajarah has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items like sugar, biscuits, soap, salt, etc.

loans.name: Alison

texts.en:
Alison is a 40-year-old businessman who lives in Juba Yei. He is married and has seven children between the ages of 14 and 3. All of them go to school. 

Alison runs a food store business in the market. He has been in this business for five years. He has no employees. Alison heard about Finance South Sudan from the loan officers' promotion. He is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more items like sugar, biscuits, soap, salt, etc. Alison has no other source of income. 

In five years' time, Alison hopes for an increase in business in the same market. 

His major challenges include earning a low income and paying his children's school fees.

Alison says that he is very happy with Finance South Sudan for supporting him financially.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, biscuits, soap, salt, etc.

loans.name: Realite De Dericour 1, 2, 3, 4, & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Wency est le coordinateur de son groupe Realite de Dericour. Il n'est pas marié et il a 1 enfants. Wency habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il  a dirigé son commerce pendant les 3 dernières années.

Wency  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans en achetant et revend des boeufs. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon le produits divers et cosmethologie

Wency dit que ses défis principal sont les manques d'achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit. Il dit que son objectif principal est d'avoir un prêt plus important à faire croître et votre entreprise avec l`aide de DIEU.
texts.en:
Wency is the coordinator of the Realite de Dericour group. She is unmarried and has one child. Wency lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. She has directed her business during the last three years.

Wency would like to use this loan to invest in buying and reselling cattle. She hopes that this loan will help her to obtain bigger business. Other members of the group need a loan for businesses such as charcoal, various products, and cosmetology.

Wency says that her main challenge is the lack of purchases and that too many people have asked her for credit. She says that her main objective is to have a larger loan to increase her business with God's help.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 36 años que junto a su esposo se han esforzado día a día para poder adquirir una casa propia donde viven sus pequeños hijos. Para poder generar los ingresos que esta familia necesita él se dedica a realizar trabajos de construcción en algunas ocasiones y en otras busca la manera de poder traer el ingreso que su familia necesita, mientras que Gladys se dedica a vender  salchipollo.

Ella tiene este negocio desde hace 2 años y decidió optar por el mismo debido a que por la zona en donde ella vive nadie se dedicaba a la venta de salchipollo ni hamburguesas, así que lo consideró como una gran opción de negocio y es gracias a este entusiasmo que ha logrado generar algunos ingresos para su familia. Gladys tiene la buena suerte de vivir en un esquina, lo que le permite estar frente al colegio de la zona, es así como también aprovecha la venta de sus productos.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva. Ella podrá realizar la compra de mesas, sillas y también desea comprar una vitrina y rellenarla de dulces para sus clientes del colegio. Con estas nuevas comodidades a sus clientes de sea cumplir su meta, la misma que consiste en abrir un pequeño local en donde vender hamburguesas de todos los tipos y así incrementar sus ingresos para lograr el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 36-year-old woman who, together with her husband, has worked hard every day and acquired her own home where she and her husband live together with their young children.  In order to make the income that their family needs, Gladys' husband sometimes works on construction jobs and on other occasions he looks for other ways to make income.  Gladys works selling 'salchipollo' (Peruvian fast food - chicken and fries).  

Gladys has been in this business for two years.  She chose it because there wasn't anybody else in her area who sold 'salchipollo' or hamburgers and so she believed it to be a great business opportunity.  Thanks to her enthusiasm, Gladys has managed to make income for her family.  She is lucky because she lives on a street corner, opposite a school.  She makes the most of this when selling her products.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Gladys will be able to buy tables and chairs for her business.  She would also like to buy a display case and fill it with sweet treats for her student customers.  With these new conveniences in place, she would like to fulfill her dream of opening small premises where she can sell all types of hamburgers and thereby increase her income so that her family can live well.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a display case to fill with sweet treats

loans.name: Aloysius

texts.en:
Aloysius is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Aloysius has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Aloysius has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more stock to his general store. The loan will help Aloysius generate greater profits and have a bigger shop. Aloysius hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children at the university level. 

Aloysius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aloysius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but whose businesses have grown too large for micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to add more stock to his general store.

loans.name: Saliva

texts.en:
Saliva is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Saliva has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Saliva has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale. This will help Saliva to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Saliva hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Saliva is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Saliva who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but whose businesses have grown too large for micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale in his general store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children; two of her children are currently in school. For the past 20 years, Eva has been working hard to manage her small shop, from which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Eva to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Eva hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a big garment shop that sells clothes. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eva who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Aleyda Areli

texts.es:
Aleyda es una mujer de 46 años que desde hace 7 años se dedica a laborar como comerciante de ropa en distintos lugares del lugar en donde vive, está actividad le ha permitido progresar constantemente y mejorar como microempresaria y persona. Aleyda vive en la ciudad de Pisco, lugar que en los últimos años ha logrado hacerse conocida por el incrementos de turistas que ha logrado obtener por los nuevos y mejorados servicios que ofrece.

Aleyda es una joven que era empacadora de pescado, pero como vio que el negocio no le resultaba tan rentable como deseaba decidió ahorrar una cantidad de dinero que le permitiese comprar ropa que pudiera vender. Es así como empezó a surgir en este tipo de negocio, con el tiempo sus ventas han mejorado, lo que le ha permitido incrementar poco a poco su capital de trabajo y así tener más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Aleyda desea poder realizar la compra de pantalones, blusas, shorts, entre otros. Lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos económicos con la finalidad de construir su casa, la cual fue afectada por el terrible terremoto de 7.9 grados en el año 2007, el cual devastó muchos hogares, no solo por las pérdidas materiales sino también por las pérdidas humanas. Aleyda desea con todo de sí culminar la construcción de su casa y desde luego seguir creciendo en el negocio y convertirse en una gran y reconocida microempresaria.
texts.en:
Aleyda is a 46-year-old woman who has been selling clothing in her area for seven years.  This business has allowed her to make constant progress and improve herself both as a micro-businesswoman and as a person.  Aleyda lives in the city of Pisco which has become well known in recent years for having increased the number of tourists it attracts owing to its new and improved services.

Aleyda is a young woman who used to work as a fish packer.  However, as she came to realize that the business wasn't as profitable as she would like, she decided to save a sum of money which would allow her to buy some clothing to sell.  This is how she started out in her current business.  Over time, her sales have improved and this has allowed her to gradually increase her working capital and have more merchandise available to sell to her customers.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Aleyda would like to buy some pants (trousers), blouses, shorts, etc.  This will allow her to increase her income with a view to re-building her house which was affected by the terrible 7.9 magnitude earthquake of 2007 which devastated many homes, causing not only material losses but also human losses.  Aleyda would like, with all her heart, to finish rebuilding her home.  She would, of course, also like to continue growing her business and become an important and well-known micro-businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, and all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

She sells mattresses and cushions in a shop that she rents. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more mattresses, pillows and cushions. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals are to expand her business so as to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses and cushions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like women's clothing, men's clothing and many others.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna, a married mother of four children, all of whom are in school, lives in Kampala, Uganda where she has been selling bunches of bananas at the market for the last five years. Berna works seven days a week, and her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water.

Berna is requesting a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her goal is to purchase a delivery van to ease her transportation challenges.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.fr: GOLD est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Odile (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans. Odile est mariée à un certain Emile. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Odile vend des produits vivriers (maïs, riz, etc.), des condiments et de l'huile d'arachide de façon secondaire. Odile exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans à son domicile. Odile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et  pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Odile désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison Odile sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GOLD. Les crédits obtenus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: GOLD is a group of three persons living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Odile (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is 48 years old. She is married to a man named Emile. The couple have three children they are responsible for, all of whom attend school. The family live together and the parents take care of the diverse household expenses. In order to pay for these expenses, Odile sells a variety of products (corn, rice, etc) as well as condiments and peanut oil. She has been doing this for four years, selling from her home. In order to increase the number of sales and to be more competitive in the market, she would like to increase the number of products she has available to sell, and thus increase her revenues. She is asking for a fifth loan from ALIDE along with the other members of the group GOLD. All previous loans were reimbursed in a timely manner.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, corn, condiments and peanut oil

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has eight children and two of her children are in school. She also takes care of four additional family members (orphans). She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Cissy operates a restaurant from home. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works six days a week. She generates additional income by selling hand-made crafts. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, maize flour, cooking oil, serving utensils and beef. 

Her major business challenge is defaulters and transportation. Her goal is to build her own house and also to own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more beef, bunches of bananas, serving utensils, cooking oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Massanh

texts.fr:
Massanh est une femme âgé(e) de 28 ans. Elle est mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto et n’a pas d’enfants.
Massanh travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale(riz, sucre, huile végétale….) depuis 2009. Elle vend avec 01 personne dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Massanh a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et des boissons. Elle veut augmenter son activité en ouvrant un débit de boissons.
texts.en: Massanh is a 28 year old woman. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver and do not have children. Massanh has been a re-seller of basic food products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil, etc) since 2009. She has the help of one other person in her store, and stocks up on merchandise in Lomé. She received her first credit from WAGES to purchase food products and drinks. She would like to increase her activity by opening a bar.

loans.use: purchase basic food products

loans.name: Alicia Magali

texts.es:
Alicia es madre soltera de dos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar. Ella es una mujer que disfruta mucho de preparar postres para sus pequeños. Actualmente vive en la ciudad de Pisco, lugar que en el transcurso de los años ha venido surgiendo tras el terrible terremoto del año 2007, es allí donde aún se pueden observar algunas secuelas de lo sucedido en aquel año.

Alicia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tubérculos, cervezas, entre otros productos que le permiten generar los ingresos que su familia necesita. Ella trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, tiempo en el que atiende a los clientes de su zona. Alicia ha logrado hacer conocida su bodega en la zona en donde vive debido a que ya tiene muchos años en este tipo de negocio, el cuál aprendió gracias a su madre.

Actualmente ella desea poder comprar más atún, huevos, galletas, sacos de azúcar, de arroz, entre otros, lo que le permitirá equipar su negocio, atraer a nuevos clientes y desde luego incrementar sus ganancias. Alicia desea ahorrar lo suficiente para poder tener un nuevo negocio en el centro de la ciudad de San Clemente  y así mejorar muchos más sus ingresos para poder darles todo lo que necesitan sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Alicia is a single mother of two school-aged little ones.  She is a mother who very much enjoys making dessert for her children.  Currently she lives in the city of Pisco, a place that has been rising up over the years after the terrible 2007 earthquake.  You can still see some consequences there of what happened that year.

Alicia works selling groceries, tubers, and beer, among other products that allow her to generate the income her family needs.  She works from 7 in the morning until 9 at night, time in which she attends to the customers of her area.  Alicia has managed to make her store known in the area where she lives because she already has many years of experience in this type of business, which she learned thanks to her mother.

Currently she wants to be able to buy more tuna, eggs, cookies, and bags of sugar and of rice, among other things.  This will allow her to equip her business, attract new customers, and, of course, increase her profits.

Alicia wants to save enough to be able to have a new business in the center of the city of San Clemente and so improve her income much more, to be able to give her small children everything they need.

loans.use: to buy tuna, eggs, cookies, and bags of sugar and of rice, among other things.

loans.name: Line

texts.en:
Line lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, and all her children are in school. She also takes care of  her father. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

Line runs a laundry service. She provides her service from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

Line has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy washing detergents, a flat iron and basins. Her major business challenges are interruptions in electricity and thieves. Her goals are to buy a plot of land and build her own house and to employ girls to assist in her laundry.

loans.use: To buy more detergents, a flat iron and basins.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, and all her children are in school. She also takes care of her father. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Sarah sells second-hand clothes at the market. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has poultry as her other source of income.

Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university and also to start importing used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones, a 37-year-old married father of three children ranging in age from 8 to 12 years, describes himself as patient. For the past 12 years Jones has operated a restaurant where he sells food, tea and snacks and employs two staff members. His business is located in a viable area, and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is the high price of ingredients for preparing food.

Jones will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell. His business goals are to do outside catering and become a supplier of food to hotels within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is 49 years old. He is married and has three children, age 21 to 14. 

He has been involved in agriculture for 20 years. He sells milk, butter, cheese and other milk products. 

At the same time he works as a master, making payments to the owners of crashed cars.

Now he wants to obtain 1,500 AZN to buy two cows for fattening to sell. From the income he wants to build an auto repair shop.

loans.use: To buy two cows for fattening.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 45-year-old businessman who lives in Juba Yei. He is married and has six children between the ages of 20 and 1. Four of them go to school. 

Joel runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for four years. He has one employee. In addition to this business, Joel is a farmer. He grows some of the food that he is selling as his other source of income. 

Joel heard about Finance South Sudan from the loan officer’s promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more items like ground nut, maize grain and many others. 

In five years, Joel would hope for better support from Finance Sudan so that he can have better production on his farm. 

His major challenges include his low income rate and school fees issues. 

Joel says that he is very happy for the support of Finance South Sudan and they should not stop with the support they have started.

loans.use: to purchase more items like ground nuts, maize grain and many others.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella, tiene la edad 49   años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos actualmente. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de cercas eléctricas para dividir los potreros y semilla de pasto para el ganado. El cuenta con un terreno apto para desarrollar la ganadería y pretende invertir en una mejor calidad de semilla, para obtener una mejor producción. El quiere implantar mas divisiones en los potreros para asi aprovechar mejor los terrenos. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de ganado. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Estrella is 49 years old and married.  She currently lives together with her husband and four children.  She plans to use her loan to buy electric fences so that she can divide up her fields.  She will also buy grass seed for her cattle.  Estrella has a suitable plot of land on which to carry out her cattle raising business and she plans to invest in buying a better quality of seed so that she can achieve better production.  She would like to create more divisions in her fields so that she can make better use of her land.  She would like to make more profits so that she and her family can live well and so that she can grow her cattle raising business.

This is Estrella's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy materials for improving her cattle farm

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children and two are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Ruth sells second-hand clothes at the market. She has been in business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. She also generates additional income through a retail shop.  

Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university level and also to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 38-year-old married man. He has three children ranging in age from 2 to 7 years old. He describes himself as an honest man. 

Thomas operates a retail business where he sells items such as snacks, sweets, and tissues, etc. He has been involved in this business for nine years. His business is located in a busy shopping market and his primary customers are local residents. Thomas describes his biggest business challenge as the high prices of the products he sells. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tissues, sweets, and snacks to sell. Thomas's dream and business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, snacks, and tissues to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a single man. He is 24 years old and lives in Brgy 5, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Joseph has a tricycle business providing transportation in the area. He has had this business for a few years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 6,000. Mr. Joseph has been a member of PMPC during this year only.

In the future, Joseph hopes to improve his living conditions by using his profits and he wants to become a franchiser of motorcycles.

loans.use: to make a down payment on a motorcycle.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina owns this grocery shop at Mpohr near Takoradi, Ghana.  She has been operating this grocery shop for five years now.  The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk, etc.  Georgina is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a small-scale miner. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. 

Georgina will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 28-year-old divorced woman. She has two children, ages 1 and 6 years old. She describes herself as reliable and responsible. 

Mildred operates a school where she provides education. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the unfavorable weather environment. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy mattresses for her students to sleep on. Her business goal is to own a school van within five years.

loans.use: to buy mattresses for her students to sleep on.

loans.name: Sanny

texts.en:
Sanny is the woman pounding fufu in this picture. She operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has done this for five years.   The foods she serves are fufu, banku, and rice balls. She lives together with her husband and six dependents. Sanny uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Sanny will use her loan to purchase the necessary ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, she plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hair dresser and she has operated a beauty salon for three years now. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver and they live together at Mpohor near Takoradi. Gladys uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their child. 

Gladys will use her loan to purchase hair extensions, wigs, hair creams, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase hair extensions, wigs, hair creams, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and lives in P-6, Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married and has six children.

Gina has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for two years. Gina requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for nine months. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail sells soft drinks, biscuits, and bread at Mpohor near Takoradi. She has been selling biscuits and drinks for two years now. Abigail is married and her husband is a mason. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Abigail will use this loan to buy more soft drinks, biscuits, and bread for sale. With the new profit, she will operate a grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, biscuits, and bread for sale

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 45 years old and lives in P-3, Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married and has children.

Virgenia has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for three years. Virgenia requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

Virgenia has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their three children at Mpohor near Takoradi. She sells salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items, and has been in this business for four years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Sophia will use her loan to purchase salted fish and other food items to sell. With the new profit, she wills expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase salted fish and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Rosemond

texts.en:
Married to a photographer and the mother of two children, Rosemond has been selling secondhand ladies' and children’s wear for the past year. She uses her income to help support her husband in the payment of their accomodation and utility bills.

Rosemond needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' wear and children’s wear to sell.

loans.name: Nonvigbe A Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGBE A est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Edwige Sènan est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Edwige Sènan est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Edwige Sènan  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Edwige Sènan est mariée à un certain Roger. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edwige Sènan vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les divers charges de la maison. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Edwige Sènan mène comme activité depuis dix huit ans, la vente de tissus et des produits de merceries dans une ville du Benin. Edwige Sènan s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Edwige Sènan sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGBE A, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Nonvigbe A group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the third time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to elevate the level of their business. The representative of the group, named Edwige Sènan, is the one who has her hand raised in the photo. Edwige Sènan is 29 years old and lives in Bénin. Edwige Sènan did not go to school. Edwige Sènan is married to a certain Roger. The couple has two children, both in school and under their care. Edwige Sènan lives together with her children and her husband and takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together with her husband. 

In order to meet her needs and those of her children, Edwige Sènan has been managing a business selling fabric and haberdashery items in a town of Bénin for 18 years. Edwige Sènan gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. In seeking to satisfy her clientèle and to grow her turnover and her income, Edwige Sènan is requesting a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Nonvigbe A group. The first two loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 53 years old, married, and has five children.  He lives in the Philippines. With his wife's assistance, Noel has a food shop or carenderia (mini-restaurant) that sells items like afritada (chicken stew made with vegetables and tomatoes) and caldereta, which he has been doing for 20 years.. He also raises and sells pigs.  

Noel is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP, which he will use to buy raw ingredients for making food.  He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Une Femme De Plus Group

texts.fr: UNE FEMME DE PLUS est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Monique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Monique est mariée à un certain Marc. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Monique vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Monique a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Monique mène comme activité la vente de paniers et de nattes de façon ambulante depuis une dizaine d'année au Benin. Monique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Monique sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe UNE FEMME DE PLUS un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
UNE FEMME DE PLUS is a group consisting of five people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group by the name of Monique (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 47 years old. Monique is married to a certain Marc. The couple has five children, all in school and under their care. Monique lives together with her children and her husband and takes care of the household responsibilities together with her husband. Monique stopped school at the secondary level. 

To take care of her different responsibilities, Monique has been managing a business selling baskets and mats as a travelling saleswoman in Bénin for about 10 years. Monique gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. With the goal of better meeting the demands of her increasing clientèle and to make more profit, Monique is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the UNE FEMME DE PLUS group. The previously received loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy baskets and mats.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene  2 pequeños junto a su esposa, la misma que se dedica a la venta de sándwich y hamburguesas en la puerta de su casa todas las noches. Actualmente esta pequeña familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, lugar que se caracteriza por el incremento de tiendas comerciales y el desarrollo económico que se refleja en sus pobladores.

Miguel se dedica a elaborar puertas y ventanas de madera, productos que son demandados en promedio 3 veces al día, para esto Miguel se dedica a laborar un promedio de 9 horas, tiempo en el que atiende a sus clientes y elabora los productos solicitados. Fue gracias a su padre que aprendió sobre este negocio, por lo que él está muy agradecido por el empeño que le puso por enseñarle.

Miguel es muy conocido por su trabajo ya que sus clientes siempre están satisfechos con los resultados. Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, él podrá realizarle el mantenimiento pertinente  a sus máquinas, a su vez podrá comprar un cepillo eléctrico.  Esto le permitirá tener un instrumento adicional para labrar la madera, ofrecerá un nuevo servicio y así su negocio podrá crecer, lo que le permitirá tener una sucursal en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú.
texts.en:
Miguel and his wife have two young children.  Every night his wife sells sandwiches and hamburgers at the door to his house.  This small family currently lives in the city of Ica, Perú.  This place is known for its growth of commercial stores and the economic development that is reflected in its inhabitants.

Miguel makes wooden doors and windows.  These products are ordered on the average of three times a week.  Therefore, Miguel works an average of nine hours a day.  He waits on his customers, and he makes the requested products.  It was thanks to his father that he learned about the business.  He is very grateful for the effort his father put into teaching him.

Miguel is well-known for his work because his customers are always satisfied with the results.

With help from the Kiva lenders he will be able to perform maintenance on his machines and buy an electric planer.  This will allow him to have an additional tool to use when working with wood.  He will offer a new service, and this way his business will be able to grow.  This will allow him to have a branch in the Parcona district, Ica, Perú.

loans.use: to have maintenance performed on his machines and to buy an electric planer.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda con su anterior credikiva aprovechó el segundo semestre del 2010, época en la cual lo que mas se vende ropa y eso fue justamente lo que hizo, por eso sus ventas se incrementaron significativamente. Como con este negocio de ropa ganó clientela, ahora va a invertir nuevamente en telas para hacer ropa en mayor cantidad, con lo cual ganará descuentos y tendrá satisfechos a sus clientes,  que desde ya se están preparando para vestir elegantes durante la celebración del día de la secretaria y de otro dia mas importante para las familias colombianas: "el día de las madres." Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y sigan apoyando mi negocio. "
texts.en: Yolanda used her previous Kiva loan to take advantage of the second half of 2010, when most clothing sales take place.  Her sales increased significantly.  Since she gained some customers with for this clothing business, she will once again invest in fabrics to make clothing in large quantity.  This will allow her to gain some discounts and also satisfy her customers, who are preparing to dress up in celebration of secretary’s day, and also another important day for Columbian families, Mother’s Day.  Her message to Kiva lenders is, “I’m very grateful to Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for continuing to support my business.”

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children. Rosario works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. She is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells food such as yams, cassava and plantains, which she has done for 2 years now. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband works with the railways company. Mary uses her income to assist the husband to feed and clothe their children. Mary will use her loan to purchase yams, cassava and plantains to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase yams, cassava and plantains to sell

loans.name: Annette

texts.en: Annette is 28 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. Annette has a general store business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing the additional groceries and consumable goods for her business. Annette became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Annette hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jhanese

texts.en: A single mother of one child, Jhanese is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines where she has had a  pigpen that sells grown pigs for the past two years. Jhanese has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to  buy animal feed for the pigs. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to start another business of charcoal selling. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She dreams of expanding to  wholesale in the future. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 40, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Prudencio, a transport operator, and they have one child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, Liezel is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Liezel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Liezel is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liezel hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladys Sandra

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 38 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora en la ciudad de Ica. Ella culminó el colegio por completo, estaba deseosa por estudiar secretariado cuando lamentablemente sus padres no tenían los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos de educación superior.

Actualmente ella labora un promedio de 5 horas diarias, caminando y recorriendo las zonas aledañas en donde vive. Ella vende ropa tanto para adultos como para niños, es este el motivo por el que la cantidad de sus clientes se ha ido incrementando en el transcurso de estos meses.

Gladys está muy deseosa de poder comprar nueva ropa, para que de esta manera sus clientes tengan más opciones y se sientan satisfechos por las compras que realizan. Ella sabe que esto permitirá que sus ingresos se incrementen y así logrará tener la tienda que tanto desea en un lugar cercano de la ciudad, a su vez realizará su gran sueño tener una Boutique en su casa.
texts.en:
Gladys, age 38, sells clothes as a street vendor in the city of Ica.  She completed her education, and she wanted to study to become an administrative assistant.  Unfortunately, her parents did not have the income that was needed to cover her higher educational expenses.

She currently works an average of five hours a day walking and traveling to the areas neighboring where she lives.  She sells clothes as much for adults as for children.  That is the reason that she has gotten more customers in the past few months.

Gladys really wants to be able to buy new clothes.  This way her customers will have more choices, and they will feel satisfied with the purchases they make.  She knows that this will allow her income to increase.  Then she will manage to have the store she wishes for so much in a place near the city.  At the same time she will fulfill her big dream of having a boutique in her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es: Eli, tiene la edad 47de  años, está casado y vive con sus tres hijos y la esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de dos novillos  para el engorde. El cuenta con varios novillos a su poder y lo que pretende es fortalecer el negocio. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con le proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Eli is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children.  He wants to use the money from this loan to buy two steers to fatten up.  He has several steers and he wants to strengthen his business.  He wants to have his animals at the ideal weight for later resale in the local market and more distant places.  He wants to generate the greatest amount of income for his well-being and that of his parents and also grow his pig business.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous bank loans, but FUDECOSUR has granted him a loan with ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip, a 44-year-old married father of four children ranging in age from 6 to 22 years, describes himself as an honest man. For the past six years he has operated a retail shop selling home products, and employs two staff members. Philip's business is located in a competitive urban area, and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the retail shop.

Philip will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home products, and his business goal is to expand his shop within five years. He hopes that he will be able to build a house for his family and improve their living standards in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of home products.

loans.name: Nuris

texts.es: Nuris de 62 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 30 y 35 años. Ella tiene un negocio donde comercializa productos energéticos dirigidos especialmente a personas que practican una actividad física, como ejercicios y aeróbicos. Su actividad la inició cuando su hijo emprendió un gimnasio y sus clientes cuando finalizaban sus actividades, requerían hidratarse para reponer la pérdida de líquido su cuerpo.  Con este negocio Nuris se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde hace 4 años, desde los cuales ha recibido 6 financiamientos, con los que ha logrado comprar en mayor volumen sus productos y con el resultado de su venta programa los pagos y se siente muy tranquila de poder hacerlo fácilmente. Su meta futura es apoyar la ampliación del Gimnasio de su hijo, adecuando otra sala donde incluiría a su vez nuevos productos. Su mayor desafío son las bajas temporadas en las cuales no hay muchos clientes como ella lo espera, pero en su experiencia conoce cuales son estas épocas y puede controlar sus inversiones. En la actualidad está aplicando a su séptimo credikiva, con el cual comprará productos energéticos y continuará aumentand su capital de trabajo por eso su credikiva es un éxito para  su nueva  inversión.
texts.en: Nuris is 62 years old, lives south of the city, and has 2 children ages 30 and 35. She has a business where she sells energy products specially aimed towards people that do a physical activity like exercises or aerobics. Her business began when her son started a gym and his customers, when finished working out, would need to hydrate themselves in order to replenish the loss of liquid in their body. With this business Nuris joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation 4 years ago. Since then she has received 6 loans, with which she has been able to purchase her products in larger volumes  and with the results of her sales she feels calm about being able to make the payments easily. Her future goal is to support the growth of her son's gym, adapting another room where she would include her products. Her greatest challenge are the low seasons in which there aren't as many customers as she hopes, but in her experience she knows when these periods are and can control her investments. Currently she is applying for her 7th kiva credit with which she will buy energy products and will continue increasing her work capital so that her kiva credit is a success for her new investment.

loans.use: to buy energy products.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona tiene 48 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos todos menores de edad, que se encuentran en la escuela. Vive en su modesta casa en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
La Sra. Ramona se dedica a la venta de chipa (alimento típico paraguayo). Ella tiene su chipería propia, hace aproximadamente 10 años, en la cual elabora las chipas que vende. Ella se ha hecho de muy buena fama debido a la buena calidad de los productos que vende. Ella realiza sus ventas en la zona de Mariano Roque Alonso. ya posee una buena clientela formada.
Solicita el crédito para la compras de materias prima que utiliza para la elaboración de las chipas que vende, como ser Harina, queso, huevos, manteca y otros. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Ramona, age 48, is married and has two minor children who go to school.  She lives in her modest house in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.

Ramona sells cheese buns.  She has had her own cheese bun bakery for approximately ten years.  That is where she makes the cheese buns that she sells.
