Morm, sixty, is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD 5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Morm is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Merlinda has a retail shop where she buys and sells  groceries scanned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Janice has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Janice has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and earns a living by selling scrap and junk in the Philippines. She has applied for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more recycled materials to sell. She has been in this business for five years, and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La Dra. Nelly es soltera y tiene un hijo menor. Alquila un local en la ciudad de San Lorenzo donde funciona su consultorio odontológico, desde el año 2007.
Ella vive con su madre, donde ahora está construyendo un pequeño departamento. Nos cuenta que anhela poder construir su salón propio para trasladar su consultorio hasta allí y poder de esa forma trabajar sin tener que estar haciendo gastos innecesarios como ser el alquiler.
 Necesita de este crédito para comprar insumos de tratamientos odontológicos para los numerosos tratamientos e intervenciones de mayor grado que realiza a sus pacientes, ya que eso es esencial para su trabajo. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Dr. Nelly is single and has a minor son.  She rents a locale in the city of San Lorenzo where her dental office has been operating since 2007.

She lives with her mother where she’s currently building a small apartment.  She tells us that her wish is to build her own space and move her dental office there so that she can work without having unnecessary expenses like rent.

She needs this loan to buy dental supplies for the numerous treatments and interventions of a higher caliber that she carries out on her patients since this is essential for her work.  She is grateful for the opportunity to make progress she’s receiving.

loans.use: to buy dental supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cecilia, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Reinaldo hace 28 años, del matrimonio nacieron 5 hijos; todos ellos viven en su humilde casa de la Ciudad Coronel Oviedo. 
La Sra. Cecilia es comerciante hace más de 11 años, tiene una mercería-librería en su casa por la cual se desvive ya que es el sustento de la Familia. Comenzó con un pequeño local de Artículos de Librería que poco a poco fue creciendo con su empeño y la ayuda de su familia. Comenta que en esta época el tema del negocio es muy difícil porque hay mucha competencia por lo que hay que luchar para mantener a la clientela con buenos precios, variedad y por sobre todo carisma en el buen trato a todos que son clientes de su comercio. 
 Se acercó a la Fundación con el objetivo de solicitar una pequeña ayuda, ya que desea comprar insumos tales como cuadernos, carpetas, libros, hojas, mochilas, etc, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 49, has been married to Reinaldo for 28 years; they have five children.  They all live together in their humble house in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

Cecilia has been a merchant for more than 11 years.  She has a variety store-stationery shop at home where she does everything she possibly can because it’s her family’s source of support.  She started out with a small space selling stationery items which gradually grew with her work and help from her family.  She comments that nowadays business is difficult because there is a lot of competition and one must struggle to retain customers with good prices, variety and above all charisma and good customer treatment for all who patronize her shop.

She called on the Fundación to ask for a small help because she wants to buy some supplies like notebooks, folders, books, sheets of paper, backpacks, etc. to stock the store and continue working.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Ivan Ernesto

texts.es: Ivan de 31 años de edad es casado, se desempeña como docente de secundaria del instituto el Almendro, solicita su primer crèdito para pagar una maestria en docencia universitaria ya que logro conseguir una media beca por medio del actual gobierno, el cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien tambien se desempeña como docente de secundaria en la misma escuela, ademàs obtienen ingresos mensuales de la venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa interior que en sus horas libres venden, ambos son reconocidos en el municipio son ser honesto y muy trabajadores, profesan la religion evangelica, su mayor sueño en la vida estar bien con Dios y que su familia siga en el buen camino.
texts.en:
Ivan is 31 years old and is married.  He works as a secondary school teacher in the Almendro institute.  He is requesting his first loan to pay for a masters degree in university teaching now that he has received a partial scholarship from the current government.  

He has the help of his wife who also works as a secondary school teacher in the same school.  They also have monthly income from the sale of cosmetics and underwear that they sell in their free time.  Both are known in town as honest and hard-working.  They are evangelicals and their greatest dream in life is to be well with God and that their family continue on the right path.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a masters degree.

loans.name: Rosa Adelaida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus  balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

La señora Adelaida tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad y estudian en universidad. Está en el Banco hace nueve  ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en el transcurso de este tiempo para aumentar su negocio que es su fuente de ingreso.

Ella es una muy buena madre que para solventar los gastos de sus hijos se  dedica a la venta de ropa, de producto Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza y perfumería y accesorios para damas) y también vende productos naturales, lo que más vende es ropa interior de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas y los productos naturales, tiene muchos clientes que le comprar sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días, trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, productos naturales y cosméticos.

Su sueño  es comprar una casa en la ciudad ya que donde viven es alquilado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, in the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful scenery and fresh water beaches frequented by many tourists, the members of the communal bank Nueva Luz (New Light) have a meeting.

Señora Adelaida is 51 years old and is the single mother of two children, both of whom are grown and study at the university.  She has been with the communal bank for nine cycles.  She likes it because of the help she has been given over time to expand her business, which is her only source of income.

Señora Adelaida is a very good mother who, in order to meet her children's expenses, makes her living selling clothing and Avon, Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and ladies accessories).  She also sells natural products.  What she sells the most of is women's lingerie, which is highly requested by the ladies, and natural products.  She has a lot of customers who purchase her products, which she leaves on credit and collects the money for each week. Señora Adelaida works every day for about five hours; she sells door to door and by taking orders.  She has been making a living in this business for more than 15 years, and it has been going very well for her.

This loan will be used to purchase clothing, natural products and cosmetics.

Señora Adelaida's dream is to purchase a house in the city, as the one they currently live in is a rental.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, natural products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El señor Héctor tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, se dedica al macate hace mas de 10 años por lo que ya tiene un poco de experiencia en este trabajo. 
El señor Héctor es una persona muy sacrificada y profesional en su trabajo, siempre trata de dar lo mejor en su actividad y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad para compartir con todos su vida profesional. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás artículos, el cual le ayudará a seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor is 34 years old and lives in the city of Itá.  He’s been a merchant for more than 10 years so he has a bit of experience in this line of work.

Héctor is a very self-sacrificing and professional in his work; he always tries to give his best in his activity and he’s grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the opportunity to share his professional life with everyone.  His goal is to continue working in order to be able to continue to help his family.

He asks for the loan to buy sheets, blankets, comforters and other items that will help him continue working and helping his family.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Malvy Luz

texts.es: Malvy con su anterior credikiva, compró productos de tocador como tintes, balsamos, laca enjuagues capilares para el ejercicio de su actividad y se mantuvo bien surtida y muy satisfecha. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente,  para comprar en mayor volumen tintes y balsamos exclusivamente, porque llegaron a un buen precio y quiere fortalecer la oferta de el servicio de tinturado de cabello, ofreciendo un precio competitivo. Su mensaje a los finacadores de Kiva, es de agradecimiento y desea que sigan apoyando a la gente que en Colombia, necesita cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Malvy purchased dressing table items such as dyes, conditioners, hairspray and hair rinses for her business and she was well supplied and very satisfied.  She is now asking for another Kiva loan in order to buy dyes and conditioners exclusively in greater volume, because she can get them at a good price and she wants to strengthen the offer of her hair dying service with a competitive price.  

Her message to the lenders of Kiva is one of thanks and she hopes that they continue helping the people of Colombia, who want to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy dyes and conditioners.

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Inmaculada” surgió mediante la promoción hecha a la a una de las miembros del grupo, quien decidió buscar para sus socias haciendo extensiva la promoción a sus amigas y vecinas. El comité está integrado por 10 mujeres de la misma zona. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.
Lilian tiene una zapatería y nos comenta que le va muy bien, ya que siempre tiene muy bien variada los tipos de zapatos que vende. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza por dar a su familia lo mejor siempre.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio y de esa forma seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Inmaculada” women’s committee arose through the promotion carried out by one of the members of the group who decided to publicize it among her friends and neighbors.  The committee is composed of ten women from the same area.  They are very united, responsible and mutually supportive; they very much want to work and to get ahead.

Lilian has a shoe shop and she comments that she does very well because she always has a very good variety of types of shoes to sell.  She defines herself as a very hardworking, enterprising woman who strives to give her family the best always.

She asks for the loan to buy all types of shoes to stock the business thus continuing to work and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell.

loans.name: Sugey Del Carmen

texts.es: Sugey del Carmen labora en la Escuela Jan Amos Comenius desde hace 10 años desempeñandose como docente de primaria y secundaria , crèdito lo requiere para comprar materiales de construcciòn y poder obtener su propia habitacion con mejores condiciones ,  ella cuenta con la ayuda economica de su papà quien labora como Albañil en su propia negocio, Sugey vive con sus padres ya que aun no se ha casado,  es una joven que le gusta gozar de mejores condiones por esa razon ha luchado con su familia  poco a poco mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda, su sueño es casarse, tener hijos y seguir estudiando  para ser una profesional con mucha experiencia.
texts.en: Sugey del Carmen has worked as an elementary and high school teacher at the Jan Amos Comenius School for 10 years. She needs this loan to buy construction materials and to be able to get her own living space with improved conditions. She currently counts on financial support from her father, who works as a stone mason in his own business. Sugey lives with her parents, as she has not yet gotten married. She is a young woman who wants to enjoy better living conditions and that's why she has struggled with her family to improve the quality of their home little by little. Her dream is to get married, have children, and continue studying so she can become an experienced profesional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria de 36 años de edad es casada, trabaja como docente de primaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que asume los gastos del hogar; Rosa solicita su 4to crèdito para concluir la contrucciòn de su cocina  y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar, se desempeñan con mucha dedicaciòn y responsabilidad, en la comunidad ambos son reconocidos como personas responsables y con buenos principios, Todos los dias tiene que viajar en un camion a las 6 de la mañana a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de su comunidad , su mayor sueño es tener una casita con mejores condiones como toda persona lo sueña, gozar de salud y que su familia permanezca unida .
texts.en: Rosa Maria, 36 years old and married, works as an elementary school teacher and has the financial support of her husband, which covers their household expenses. Rosa is taking out her fourth loan in order to finish with the construction of her kitchen and realize better conditions for her home. She and her husband carry on with a great deal of diligence and responsibility and they are both recognized in their community as responsible and principled people. Every day, she heads out by truck at 6:00 in the morning to take on the task of teaching the rural children in her community. Her big dream is to have a home with better conditions, like everyone hopes for, to enjoy her health and that her family remains close.

loans.use: to build her kitchen.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Las Mariposas está conformado por diez emprendedoras que luchan cada día para salir adelante con cada uno de los negocios que tiene y brindarle a su familias lo mejor, este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en crédito ya que ellos han aprovechando bien el financiamiento invirtiendo en los negocios y así aumentar sus productos  que les ofrecen a sus clientes variedad. Maria es una emprendedora parte de este grupo de emprendedoras su actividad a la que se dedica es una pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes con variedad de productos para el hogar, con el financiamiento comprara granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, pan, jabones, verduras, huevos entre otros productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
The "Las Mariposas" (The Butterflies) communal bank is made up of 10 women entrepreneurs who fight every day to get ahead with their businesses and provide their families with the best.  This group of hardworking women has already received loans through Fundación León 2000.  They have made good use of the loan, investing it in their businesses and increasing their product lines so they can offer variety to their customers. 

Maria is one of the members of this group.  She has a grocery store located in a room in her house where she waits on customers.  She offers a variety of household products.  With the loan she will purchase basic grains, rice, beans, oil, candy, bread, soaps, vegetables and eggs, along with other household goods.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, rice, beans, oil, candy, bread, soap, vegetables, eggs, and other household products.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 24-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for four years and is facing hardships of price fluctuations and inflation. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and diversifying his business to include farming. James wants a loan to buy stock like sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: to buy stock like sugar and cooking oil  for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Catherine has a business selling yellow bananas.  She has been in this business for five years and she works seven days out of every week.  Catherine sells her products at the market by means of retail.  Catherine has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of yellow bananas. She also generates additional income through selling charcoal and tomatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Catherine include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build her own house. Catherine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, fees and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Jose Antonio Del Barrio Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio san José de la cuidad de Caacupé. Se hallan actualmente en el ciclo número 4 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Son mujeres con muchas ganas de salir y progresar por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas.
Victorina forma parte de este grupo y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas, ya sean de vestir o de sport. Tienen muy buena clientela siempre por que ofrece muy buenos productos a sus clientes. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, las cuales podrá vender y de esa forma poder tener bien abastecido su negocio. Agradece a la fundación y Kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: The women of this group are from the San José neighborhood in the city of Caacupé.  They are currently in the fourth cycle of the program for enterprising women of the Fundación Paraguaya.  They are women with a great desire to get ahead and to progress by means of working together as a group.  Victorina forms part of this group and she comments that she is dedicated to selling clothing, whether for dress-up or for sports.  She always has very good customers because she offers very good products to her clients.  Her goal is to continue working in this way to be able to continue helping her family.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase clothing, which she will be able to sell and in that way have a good inventory in her business.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Naume

texts.en: Naume is 44 year old with seven children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda and has a personal goal of educating her children. She has been running a restaurant for the last 19 years and her major hardships are price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, she has a vision of buying land to grow crops. Naume needs the loan to buy soda and mineral water to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Older

texts.es: Older, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa actualmente que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar materiales para la remodelación de su hogar y comprara cemento, madera y arena para estas mejoras. El cuenta con la casa ya construida y le quiere hacer unos arreglos mas para mejorar su apariencia a su casa y darle un mejor acabado, también él piensa en la seguridad de sus utensilios de hogar por lo cual hará las mejoras. El quiere brindarle a su esposa una buena estadía en su hogar y tener un ambiente familiar de armonía y seguridad dentro de su hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Older is 30 years old and married.  He lives with his wife, who is his top priority.  With this loan he will buy materials to remodel his house, including cement, wood, and sand to make improvements.  His home is already built, but he wants to fix it up to improve its appearance and have better finishings.  He is also thinking about the security of his household goods so he wants to make these improvements.  He wants to be able to provide his wife with a better situation in her home, and have an environment of family harmony and security in the house.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan through the State banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José Ángel, tiene la edad  de 59 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa, un hijo y su nieto que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito quiere comprar materiales como cemento, arena y otros más para remodelar su hogar. El cuenta con la casa ya y lo que quiere es darle una mejor presentación y mayor seguridad a sus pertenecías cuando salen de paseo. El quiere darle un ambiente de armonía a su familia y vivir en un hogar digno para convivir y pasar buenos momentos. El quiere mejorar su casa al máximo para que su familia este siempre contenta y feliz de su hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jose Angel, 59, is married and lives with his wife, a child and his grandchild, who are his main priority.  With this loan, he wants to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and other supplies to renovate his house.  He has a house already; what he wants to do is to give it a better appearance and better security for their belongings when they go out.  He wants to provide his family with an environment of harmony and a decent home where they can live and share good times.  He wants to improve the house as much as he can, so that his family is always content and happy with their house.  This is the first loan that Jose Angel has received from FUDECOSUR. Prior to this he had not taken loans from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan that has comfortable payments and an interest rate much lower than what the banks charge.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 59-year-old married man living in Kasese Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and buy a car. He has been dealing in the sale of clothes for the last eight years. His major hardship is finding customers. However, he has a goal of expanding his business to new markets and setting up a modern boutique. Jackson needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove, pots, and pans.

loans.name: Adriana Marcela

texts.es: Adriana compró con su credikiva, maní, aceitunas, semillas de marañón. Pistachos, canela manzanilla y las empacó e hizo su buena venta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con le cual comprará productos de mayor rotación,  como canela y clavito, porque se prepara para dará respuesta a la semana santa, temporada en la que sus clientes preparan sus propios dulces y agregan justamente los productos que vende Ariana, por eso la inversión promete ser exitosa y ganará dinero rápidamente, aumentando su capital de trabajo. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco la confianza depositada en mi, con respecto al crédito anterior. Espero su respaldo en esta nueva solicitud ya que su financiación me permite fortalecer cada día más mis ingresos. “
texts.en:
Adriana used her Kiva loan to buy peanuts, cashew seeds, pistachio nuts, cinnamon, and chamomile.  She packaged them and they sold well.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy products with fast turnover such as cinnamon, and cloves because Holy Week is coming, the season when her customers make their own sweets and add just the products that Adriana sells.  She promises that the loan will be successful and will make the money quickly, increasing her working capital.  
Her message to the Kiva financiers is “I appreciate the trust you have placed in me with the last loan.  I hope that you also support me in this new request since the financing helped me strengthen my earnings every day”.

loans.use: to buy products with a quick turnover such as cinammon and cloves

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda with a personal goal of educating his children. For eight years now, he has been running a retail shop. After starting with capital of 200,000 UGX, it has grown to 2,000,000 UGX. His major hardship is seasonal customers. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to to new areas, and diversifying his business. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy rice and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and salt to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos reside al sur de la ciudad,  con esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 8 años, respectivamente. A través de un negocio que inició hace 8 años aproximadamente, ha logrado genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia  y pagar la educación  de sus hijos y de su esposa, a quien le costeo una carrera técnica. En su actividad   diaria ofrece  el  servicio de lavado de muebles, alfombras, cortinas, cojineria de autos etc.   Sus clientes están ubicados especialmente en el sector norte de la ciudad.  Carlos con sus ingresos cubre los  gastos operativos del negocio  los y familiares; en algunas ocasiones, cuando hay mucha demanda del servicio, necesita   de un ayudante y a este   le paga por días, así mismo Cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para trabajar;  sus cuentas por cobrar rotan con agilidad y su margen de rentabilidad es adecuado para el tipo de negocio que maneja. En la actualidad está planeando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  el objetivo de esta inversión,  es la compra de una maquina aspiradora seco-húmeda, que requiere para dar un mejor acabado al servicio que presta, él tiene unos ahorros pero aun le falta parte del dinero para lograr una buena compra.  Su sueño es lograr la educación de sus hijos y a futuro tener una casa propia, mientras esto ocurre, Carlos no dejará de moverse entre, solventes  mineral es para diluir, desmanchador y champú, materias primas con las cuales trabaja diariamente.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the southern part of the city of Barranquilla with his wife and their two children, ages four and eight. Through a business that he started about eight years ago, he has succeeded in bringing in enough income to provide for his family and to pay for the education of his children as well as his wife, who is pursuing a technical degree. 

His main activity is running a cleaning service for furniture, pillows, curtains, car seats, etc... His customers are located mostly in the northern part of the city. With his earnings, Carlos covers both his operating and household expenses. On certain occasions, when there is a lot of work, he takes on an assistant, who he pays daily as well. He has the equipment he needs to work, his accounts fluctuate smoothly, and his profit margin is sufficient for the type of business he runs.  

At the moment, he is planning for this loan, the first he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Kiva field partner], with the goal of investing in a steam cleaner vacuum that he needs to provide fuller service. He has some savings, but he is still short some of the money he needs to make a good purchase. His dream is to provide an education for his children and to have his own home in the future. In the meantime, he won't let up on his daily work.

loans.use: to buy a steam cleaner vacuum.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used to deal in produce and after saving enough profits, he started an electronic shop, which he has been operating for two years.The 34-year-old man is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He has challenges of inadequate capital to purchase stock and price fluctuation. He dreams of educating his children and buying land to grow crops. John wants the money to buy electronics like radios to sell.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 38-year-old who is married with six children. He operates a bar business, which he has run for six years now .Joseph was first in agriculture where he harvested maize. Then he sold and got start-up capital for a bar business. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting the business growth. He has a dream of educating his children. He wishes to expand his business to other new markets and diversify businesses. Joseph wants a loan to buy beer, sodas and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas and spirits to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a married woman. She has four children and three of them are enrolled in school. Mwanakombo operates a restaurant business and her potential customers are town dwellers. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Mwanakombo's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be theft because of insecurity in the business and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Mwanakombo will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil. Mwanakombo aspires to establish a hotel in the future. She joined Yehu to access to financial services to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Julia Maxmiliana

texts.es:
La socia Julia es una persona bien emprendedora y responsable ,la socia actualmente se dedica al negocio de restaurante hace poco que empeso este negocio y le va bien ,a la vez la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de belleza como perfumes y colonias , la socia vende estos productos a sus amistades,familiares y personas que le solicitan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicito el prestamo para la compra de mas mercaderia para su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes y colonias.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Julia is a very entrepreneurial and responsable person. She currently runs a restaurant that she started only recently, but is going well. From time to time, Julia buys beauty products like perfumes and colognes for sale to her friends, family members, and other people who put in orders. In this way she gets her family ahead. 

Julia is taking out this loan to buy more merchandise for her beauty product business. She counts herself very fortunate for the opportunity this program offers her and she is committed to making all her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her beauty products business, such as perfumes and colognes.

loans.name: Rashidi

texts.en: Rashidi is a 29-year-old gentleman who is married with three children. He operates a bookshop business, which has lasted for five years now. He started slowly by selling books and pens and now he has a stock of around 10,000,000 shillings. Rashidi faces a problem of inadequate capital and price fluctuation and has a dream of having his children educated .He would like to move his business to other permanent locations and to provide secretarial services. He wants a loan to purchase a photocopying machine for the business.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopying machine for the business.

loans.name: Saydali

texts.ru: Сайдали житель района Восеъ. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Сайдали занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 18 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят с целью увеличения количества скота.
texts.en: Saydali lives in the Vose region. He is 38 years old. He is married, with five children. His wife is a homemaker. Saydali raises cattle. He has been in this business for 18 years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy calves in order to expand his livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Las Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta en el ciclo nº 4,  mantienen el grupo con un excelente comportamiento de pago .El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es seguir trabajando, fomentar el espiritu solidario y mantener la unidad del grupo.
La sra. Maria es una de las miembros del grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de joyerias. Sus ventas cada vez van mejor ya que siempre tiene muy buena calidad de productos y es gracias a ello que atrae a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de todo tipo de joyas, como ser cadenas, pulseras, anillos y demás. Agradece a la fundacion y a kiva, por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
This committee is in their 4th loan cycle. The group has a great record for making their payments. The goal of each one of them is to continue working and to encourage a united spirit to maintain unity within the group. 

Maria is one of the group members, who makes a living selling jewelry. Her sales continue to improve because she always has quality products which allow her to attract more clients. 

She has requested the loan to buy all kinds of jewelry, like chains, bracelets, rings and other items. She is thankful to the communal bank and to Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to re-sell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred  is 24 years old and married with no children yet. He operates a produce business, which he has run for a period of three years now. Fred was first in motorcycle transport then he started a produce business and it has improved steadily. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting the business growth. He has a dream of educating his future children and self-education. He wishes to expand his business to other new markets and buy land for growing crops. Fred wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy, 32 years old and single, lives with three of her family members and is the sole bread winner. The owner of a  timber-selling business, she faces the challenges of high taxes and theft. Dorothy is requesting this loan to buy timber, and dreams of expanding her business to new markets and buying a motorcycle to start a transport business.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Del Barrio San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación  surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona. Es un grupo antiguo y trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2006. Actualmente se encuentran  en el  ciclo 19. 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María, ella se dedica  a la fabricación y venta de productos de limpieza y también hace limpieza en casas particulares.  Comenta que gracias a su arduo y sacrificado trabajo, ha podido salir adelante y así ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para las compras de cloro, aromatizantes, desinfectantes y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los productos de limpieza que vende. Agradece la oportunidad que le está dando Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación came about as a result of promotions by the lender which were undertaken in the area.  It is a long-standing group, which has worked with the Foundation since 2006.  They are currently in their 19th lending cycle.

One of the members of this group is Señora María.  She works making and selling cleaning products, and also does house-cleaning in several homes.  She comments that thanks to her hard and self-sacrificing work, she has been able to move ahead in life and in this way support her family.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of bleach, air-fresheners, disinfectants and other supplies to be able to continue making her cleaning products which she sells.  She is grateful for this opportunity which Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase bleach, air-fresheners, disinfectants and other supplies to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a widowed woman. She has four children. Mwanakombo operates a grocery business and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be theft because of insecurity in business and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Mwanakombo will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. Mwanakombo aspires to establish a wholesale grocery shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access financial services to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 43-year-old father of seven children who operates a retail business in Kagadi. He has operated this business for 10 years. Joseph started as a market vendor and accumulated capital, then started a retail shop .He says inadequate capital is the hindering factor towards the growth of this business. He would like to educate his children and he wants to move the business to a more permanent location. He wants a loan to buy soap, sodas, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sodas and sugar to sell

loans.name: Frista

texts.en: Frista is a 54-year-old woman who is operating a produce business, which she has run for a period of four months now .Frista was first in agriculture where she got capital and started the produce business .Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting the business growth. She has a dream of building a permanent home. She wishes to expand her business to other new markets and buy land for growing crops. Frista wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children .

loans.name: La Alegría Group

texts.es:
El comité La Alegria; son de la zona de San Lorenzo, son todas señoras muy trabajadoras que nunca tuvieron problema en el pago por que nunca se dejaron estar, ya que siempre se esforzaron y lucharon.
Fermina es una persona muy trabajadora, y nos comenta que se dedica a hacer todo tipo de confites. Ella gracias a la habilidad que tiene con las cosas dulces ha podido salir adelante y levantar su negocio, y gracias a ese esfuerzo hoy en día es una microempresaria exitosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos que necesita para poder hacer los confites, como ser harina, manteca, azúcar y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo de fundación y de kiva.
texts.en:
The "La Alegria" communal bank is from the San Lorenzo area. They are all very hardworking ladies who have never had a problem with repayments. They have never let themselves go, because they have always strived and worked hard.
Fermina is a very hardworking person, and she tells us that she makes all kinds of pastries. Thanks to the skills she has with sweet things, she has been able to get ahead and get her business up and running. It's because of that effort that she's a successful micro-entrepreneur today.
She requests the loan in order to purchase the supplies she needs for making the pastries, such as flour, butter, sugar and other items. She gives thanks for the help she's getting from Fundación and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Orquideas” se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 12 integrantes, donde  todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas.
Mirna forma parte de este grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de perfumes hace ya un tiempo. Tiene una buena clientela gracias a la variedad que siempre tiene. Gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, con lo cual podrá abastarse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group 'Las Orquideas' (The Orchids) are in their first cycle of the program 'Mujeres Emprendedors' (Entrepreneurial Women) in the 'Fundación Paraguaya'. There are 12 group members who all are involved in different economic activities. 

Mirna is one of the group members. She makes a living selling perfumes, which she has been doing for some time now. She has a good customer base, thanks to the variety of products she always has on hand. Thanks to her business she has been able to help her family and give them what they need.  

She has requested a loan to buy perfumes, with which she will restock, allowing her to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to re-sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo por medio de una de las miembros quien conformaba un comité de su comunidad, se retiro de dicho comité por motivos personales y decidió formar uno dentro de su comunidad. El grupo actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa y desean seguir hasta el nivel más alto del programa de la fundación.
La Sra Lucina tiene 33 años de edad, está casada con el Sr Gerardo quien es Alfarero, juntos tienen 2 hijos. La Sra. Lucina es Comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, como ser  azúcar, yerba, panificados, sal fina, café, lácteos, etc.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, yerba, panificados, sal fina, café, lácteos, etc. Con lo cual podrá abastecer su local y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed by one of the members who was part of a communal bank in her community.  She since retired from that communal bank for personal reasons, and decided to set one up in her community.  The group is currently in their first lending cycle in the program, and wants to continue to a higher level in the Fundación's program.

Señora Lucina is 33 years old, and is married to Señor Gerardo, who is a potter.  They have two children together.  Señora Lucina works in retail, she sells everyday products such as sugar, yerba, bakery items, ground salt, coffee, dairy products, etc.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sugar, yerba, bakery items, ground salt, coffee, dairy products, etc.  With this, she will be able to stock up her premises and meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food store.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La socia  Maria Cristina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora ,la socia actualmente se dedica al negocio de restaurante ella vende almuerzos en la tarde,la socia tiene poco tiempo en este negocio el cual le esta yendo bien ,ella vende arroz con pollo,saltado,estofados,caldos entre otros, anteriormente la socia se dedicaba a la venta de ropa de baños pero no le fue bien en el negocio asi que decidio empesar un nuevo negocio (restaurante),ella  espera que le vaya bien para de esta manera seguir sacando adelante a su familia.

La socia solicito el prestamo para la compra de viveres como arroz,fideos,aceite entre otros.
 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She's currently in the restaurant business and sells lunch in the afternoons. She has been in the business for a short amount of time and it's going well. She sells rice with chicken, steak with potatoes, stews and soups, among other dishes. She used to sell bathing suits, but the business didn't go so well, so she decided to start a new one (the restaurant). She hopes that it goes well so that she can continue to get her family ahead.
She requested the loan in order to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, noodles, olive oil, etc.
The member is thankful for the opportunity she's being given with the loan. She also pledges to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, noodles, olive oil, etc.

loans.name: Shalom Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Shalom es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que conciste en ofrecer productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes,colonias entre otros,la socia vende estos productos a sus amistades y familiares que le solicitan,la socia a la vez se dedica a la distribucion de productos como cereales ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo distribuyendo a las tiendas y bodegas que les solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de productos de belleza como cremas y colonias para su negocio.


La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Shalom is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets her family ahead. She owns a small business that consists of selling beauty products such as lotions, perfume, cologne, etc. to relatives and friends who request them. She also distributes goods such as cereals. She works with her husband in distributing the goods to grocery stores and eateries that request them. This is the way she gets her family ahead.
The member requests the loan in order to purchase beauty products such as lotions and cologne for her business.
She's thankful for the opportunity she's being given with the loan. She also pledges to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as lotions and cologne for her business.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Renacer” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2011 mediante la promoción hecha a una de las miembros. La misma ha decidido invitar a sus amigas y vecinas y logró formar un grupo integrado por 12 mujeres de la misma zona. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo y familiarmente.
Aurora es una de las integrantes, y nos cuenta que ella se dedica a la venta de verduras de todo tipo, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas, y también variadas hortalizas. Comenta que le va bien en el negocio, ya que tiene ya una clientela bien definida que siempre compra de ella sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas y demás verduras, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener mayor variedad y mejor calidad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Renacer” ["Rebirth"] Women's Committee has worked with the Paraguaya Foundation since 2011, thanks to the promotion made to one of the members. This person decided to invite her friends and neighbors, and she succeeded in forming a group made up of 12 women from the same area. The ladies are very united and responsible and have great solidarity. They have a great desire to work and get ahead, both as a group and for their own families. 

Aurora is one of the members, and she reports that she works selling vegetables of all kinds, such as tomatoes, peppers, onions and other vegetables. She comments that her business is going well for her, since she already has a well-defined customer base who always buy her products. 

She is requesting the loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions and other vegetables. This will allow her to stock up and offer a greater variety and better quality to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 55 years old and a single mother of three children. For five years, Florence has been running a clothing business and she faces challenges of high fuel and transport costs. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets. She intends to use the loan for buying clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes.to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is 37 years old and a hard worker with two children living in Hoima, Uganda. He owns a business selling clothes, which he has been operating for quite a long time. He faces the challenges of price fluctuations and seasonal variations. His family goal is to educate his children and build a more permanent house for his family. His business dream is to expand to new markets and become self-sustaining without credit facilities. He intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Melissa;la socia es una persona emprendedora y responsable,ella trabaja en una institucion estatal, ella es secretaria y trabaja durante el dia, la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a su otro negocio que es venta de artesania ,la socia elabora anillos, aretes, brazaletes y diferentes adornos y venta de marcos y cuadros.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio de artesania en la compra de materiales como alambres para la elaboracion de joyas como aretes y pulseras .

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Melissa belongs to the communal bank 'Choquequirao'. She lives in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Melissa is an entrepreneurial and responsible person. She works in a government office as a secretary during the day, and also continues with her other business selling hand crafted jewelry. She makes rings, earrings, bracelets and different decorations and accessories. 
	
She has requested the loan to buy supplies to make her jewelry, like wire to make earrings and bracelets. 

She infinitely values and appreciates the loan she has received, which has allowed her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make jewelry.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 23-year-old woman with one child. She operates a boutique business, which she has run for a period of six years now. Jackline got start-up capital from the produce business she carried out first. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are factors affecting the business growth. She has a dream of building a permanent home and educating her child. She wishes to expand her business to other new markets and diversify her business. Jackline wants a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling timber. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a workshop to sell timber in the future. 

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to pay school fees for her child. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa" surgió gracias a promociones hecha en la zona, están en 1º ciclo del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, integrada por 10 señoras.   Esperan seguir   unidas en el grupo y  mejorar la educación de sus hijos mediante las capacitaciones brindadas por el programa y lograr escalar hasta el nivel más alto.
Cynthia forma parte del grupo, y nos cuenta que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día y que gracias a este esfuerzo ha podido ayudar a su familia y tener los medios que necesita. Ella se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es un alimento tradicional de Paraguay, le va muy bien, ya que siempre se come la chipa, sin importar la temporada del año.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas, con lo cual podrá tener para sus ventas del día a día. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa" communal bank began thanks to the promotions made in the area. They're in their first loan cycle of the program for enterprising women. It is comprised of ten ladies who hope to keep united with the group and to improve their children's education with the training the program provides them. They hope to reach for the highest level.
Cynthia is part of the group, and she tells us that she works every day, starting at the earliest hours. Thanks to that effort she has been able to support her family and make a living. She sells chipas, which are a traditional dish in Paraguay. The business does well, since people always eat chipas, no matter what season of the year it is.
She requests the loan in order to purchase chipas so that she can have enough for her daily sales. She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the help she's getting.

loans.use: to purchase chipas (typical Paraguayan cheesy buns) for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a 39-year-old, married father of three children who lives in Hioma, Uganda. He is the sole bread-winner, and for seven years he has been operating a bar and lodge. He has been able to buy a plot and build a house due to this business. 

Justus's family goal is to educate his children and buy a car. He dreams of expanding his business to new markets and moving it to a permanent location. He intends to use the loan to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas to sell in his bar.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña guapa es de la ciudad de Luque, esta integrado por 15 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que se unieron con la esperanza de ayudar  a sus familias e hijos. Actualmente se encuentran en el 4to. Ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
La Sra Ambrosia tiene 50 años de edad. es soltera, ella se dedica a la Venta de Sabanas, en lo que le va muy bien, ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos del dia a dia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Kuña Guapa" is from the town of Luque. It's comprised of 15 women. They're all friends and neighbors from that town who came together in hopes of supporting their families and their children. They're currently in their 4th cycle of the program for enterprising women.
Ambrosia is 50 years old and single. She sells sheets, which is going very well for her, since she always gets a lot of orders from her customers. Her goal is to keep on working so that she can help her family with their daily expenses.
She requests the loan in order to purchase sheets, so that she can get a wider variety of merchandise to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sheets for selling.

loans.name: Shohrukhdjon

texts.ru: Шохрухджон проживает в районе Муминобод. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он один работает в семье. Шохрухджон занимается развозкой пассажиров с одного места на другое. Он берет кредит для ремонта автомобиля и дома.
texts.en: Shohrukhdjon lives in the Muminobod region. He is 30 years old, married, and has three children. He is the only breadwinner in the family. Shohrukhdjon transports passengers to their destinations. He is taking this loan to repair his vehicle and his home.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purchase of sodas, juices, drinks, snacks, cookies, candies

loans.name: Zivamuntuyo Kyamujanju Group

texts.en:
Agatha is a 32-year-old female with four children who operates a bar which she has run for four years. She received start-up capital from farming, which was her mother's trade from way back. 

Agatha says that her business is affected by inadequate capital and price fluctuations. She would like to see her children get a good education and would like to expand her business to other markets. Agatha is a member of Zivamuntuyo Kyamujanju, a village bank group where each member guarantees the others. She would like a loan to buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 61-year old married man with children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a pub which he started ten years ago through personal savings. His major challenge is inadequate capital to purchase inventory. His dream is to educate his children and to move the business to a more permanent location. Paul needs this loan to buy more crates of beer and sodas.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blouses for adults and children, underwear and skirts.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce used the previous loan to complete her rental houses. As a way to increase her income, she has now opened a shop. She would like more capital to buy general merchandise like sugar and bread for her shop. 

Joyce's biggest challenge is high fuel and transportation costs. Her dream is to educate her children and to diversify her business into a big wholesale shop. She needs this loan to buy general merchandise like sugar and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar and bread to sell.

loans.name: Hendrich

texts.en:
Hendrich lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother).  

Hendrich has a business of selling fruits and vegetables like fresh peas, fresh beans and cabbages. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Hendrich sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Hendrich has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of fresh peas and beans and cabbages. She also generates additional income through selling charcoal and tomatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Hendrich include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house and also to start growing peas and beans. Hendrich lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, fees and electricity.

loans.use: to buy more bags of fresh peas and beans.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 33 years old. He lives in the village, Ikalto, East Georgia, with his mother and two sisters (26 and 38 years old). His mother is a housewife. George’s young sister works as teacher in the village. His elder sister knits woolen shirts and sells them in the village. George is leading the agricultural business of the family. He has 3 milk cows and 2 pigs in family owned farm. George produces cheese and sells it to local dairy product retailers. Also, he sells piglets in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris. 

George has requested credit for purchasing calfs. He will raise them for 5 months and sell them in late summer for higher prices. The income of the family will increase. George will use part of the increased income for further development of family farm and the other part will be used for purchasing needed household goods, which will improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calfs.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (father, mother and young brother). Justine has a business of a restaurant selling samosas, donuts mango juice and milk. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Justine sells her products from home, by means of retail.  

Justine has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of mango juice, milk, samosas, donuts and cakes. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenge(s) for Justine include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler, to build rental and also to start frying those products herself. Justine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, fees and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of mango juice and milk, donuts, samosas and cakes.

loans.name: Luzari's Group

texts.en:
Luzari's group is comprised of 4 hard working women. Luzari is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the FortPortal region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Luzari has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells firewood. 

To help expand her business, Luzari has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood for resale, and will help Luzari to generate greater profits and for her medical expenses. Luzari hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Luzari is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Luzari's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for resale.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
San Jose es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Santaní, esta integrado por 12 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se esfuerzan siempre al máximo para poder dar a sus familias lo mejor siempre. Desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa, y es por ello que trabajan arduamente.
Ambrosia es una de las miembros de este grupo, ella se dedica al macate, es decir, vende sabanas, frazadas, edredones, colchas y demás, en forma ambulante. Comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, pues debe recorrer las calles para poder vender los productos que tiene, haga frío o calor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, edredones, colchas y demás, con lo que podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Jose is the group formed in the city of Santaní, made up of 12 women, all of them friends and residents of that city. They are very hardworking and enterprising women, who always put out their maximum effort in order to give their families always the best. They wish to achieve the highest level of the program and that is why they work so hard. 

Ambrosia is one of the members of this group. She earns a living as a street vendor, that is, she sells sheets, blankets, duvets/ comforters, bedspreads and other items in ambulatory fashion. She comments that her work is very demanding, since she must travel through the streets in order to be able to sell the products she has, whether it's hot or cold out. 

She is seeking the loan in order to purchase sheets, duvets/ comforters, bedspreads and other items, with which she will be able to supply her business and thus be able to have more products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, duvets/ comforters, bedspreads and other items.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом проживает районе Восеъ. Она разведена. Ей 43 года. У нее пятеро детей. Двое ее сыновей находятся в России. Сама Гуландом занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. В этой области она 15 лет. Гуландом берет кредит для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en:
Gulandom lives in the Vose region. She is 43 years old, divorced, and has five children. Two of her sons are in Russia. 

Gulandom raises cattle and has been doing this for 15 years. She is taking this loan to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dorian Daniel

texts.es: Dorian  de 41 años,  es comerciante de productos de aseo personal, víveres y prendas de vestir; reside en el municipio de Galapa junto a su esposa y un hijo de 11 años de edad. Su experiencia data desde hace 21 años  aproximadamente, cuando aprendió esta actividad de su padre. En su negocio vende gel, talcos, jabones, crema dental y en general productos de aseo personal, a clientes en la ciudad de Santa Marta y en el municipio de Galapa, en unidades de medidas como la docena y por cajas.   Su mercado lo conforman especialmente las tiendas y misceláneas y alguna que otra ama de casa, que constantemente hacen pedidos, a los cuales Dorian debe responder oportunamente, para ser exitoso. Con las ventas de su negocio, cubre sus costos operativos y sus gastos familiares,  quedándole un margen de utilidad que invierte en pequeñas cantidades, pero que no es suficiente para hacer compras en mayor volumen y expandir su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara,  jabones, gel y útiles de aseo personal. El éxito de su credikiva es que aumentará sus posibilidades de compra con descuentos y   en un mayor y diversificado  volumen de productos, generando un mayor margen de utilidad.  Su meta mas adelante es tener un local tipo depósito,  donde mantener la mercancía que compra y su gran reto es ampliar su capital de trabajo, así como extender su clientela.
texts.en:
Dorian, 41 years of age, is a merchant who sells personal grooming products, groceries and clothing. He resides in the municipality of Galapa along with his wife and one son who is 11 years old. His experience dates back approximately 21 years, when he learned this business from his father. In his business he sells gels, talcum powder, soaps, toothpaste and personal grooming products in general, to customers in the city of Santa Marta and in the municipality of Galapa, in quantities such as by the dozen and by the box. His market is made up especially of shops and general stores and the occasional housewife, who are constantly placing orders to which Dorian must respond in a timely manner in order to be successful. 

With the sales from his business, he covers his operating costs and household expenses, leaving a small profit margin which he invests in small quantities of products. However it is not sufficient for him to invest in larger volumes and expand his customer base. Thus he has turned to a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Santo Domingo, through which he will purchase soaps, gels and personal grooming products. His Kiva loan's success will be to increase his purchasing power in order to buy, at a discount, a greater and more diversified volume of products, generating great profit margins. 

His goal for the future is to have premises where he may store the merchandise he purchases. His biggest challenge is to increase his working capital, as well as his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, gels and personal grooming products.

loans.name: Alfredo Omar

texts.es:
Alfredo, vive con su familia, su esposo y 3 hijos, todos trabajan en la familia, él se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, comenzó por iniciativa propia, con el apoyo de su padre, trabaja sin un horario establecido.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tres cerdos para aumentar la granja, con ellos lograra venderlos a futuro y tener más utilidades, esto le dará mayor seguridad y fortaleza en el negocio.
La aspiración de Alfredo es tener más grande el negocio, aumentar los clientes y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo lives with his family, his wife and three children, all of whom work. He devotes himself to raising pigs which he began by his own initiative with the support of his father. He works without any fixed schedule. 

Currently he is seeking a loan for the purchase of three pigs with which to expand the farm. He will be able to sell them in the future and make more profits, which will give him greater security and strengthen the business. 

Alfredo's aspiration is to make the business larger, increase the number of customers, and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is a musician. He has his own music apparatus and plays and sings at various parties in his district when he has orders. Along with this, Mikheil is involved in family agricultural activities. They have a vineyard. Mikheil sells harvested grapes in the village to local vine producing companies. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 laris.

Mikheil is 39 years old. He lives in the village of Kondoli, East Georgia, with his family: three children (13, 14 and 18 years old) and his retired parents. Mikheil is divorced from his wife and he is a single father. His elder daughter is a student and the younger daughter and son go to school. 

Mikheil requested credit for repairing his car which is out of order. He needs a car to reach his clients and to take his music apparatus there. Also, he uses the car for transportation to the vineyard. After Mikheil repairs his car, he will be able to continue working and making planned income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for business purposes

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children – two are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Harriet operates a restaurant at the market. She has been in this business for the last two years. Harriet works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas, rice, cooking oil, beef and chicken. Her major business challenges are defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, cooking oil, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Oliver's Group

texts.en:
Oliver's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Oliver is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and cover her medical expenses. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Oliver's future prospects by showing her to how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with 3 children and all her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (mother and father). She has a retail shop and sells her products on retail basis. She also does some farming from home. She has been in this business for the last 13 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of rice & sugar, cooking oil, and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges are seasonality, ever increasing prices of commodities, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to  become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar and rice, cooking oil, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is comprised of five hardworking women. Jackline is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and pay some school fees for her children. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a car for herself. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training. The ELA program has improved Jackline's future prospects by helping her learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Ruth is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her small market selling food. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock in her business and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and for her medical expenses. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training. The ELA program has improved Ruth's future prospects by helping her to get a loan at her age.

loans.use: to increase stock in her business.

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.ru: Бибинисо жительница города Куляб. Ей 41 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж таксист. Сама она у себя дома печет булочки и выносит для продажи на рынок. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 16 лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки и дров.
texts.en: Bibiniso lives in the city of Kulob. She is 41 years old, married, and has five children. Bibiniso's husband drives a taxi, while she bakes buns at home and takes them to the market to sell. Bibiniso has been doing this for 16 years. She is taking this loan to purchase flour and firewood.

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 50 years old. He lives in the village of Chikaani, East Georgia. Nodar lives alone in his house. He has a sheep farm. In particular, he has 450 sheep. In summer, the sheep are in the mountains. Nodar pays two shepherds, who take care of the sheep. In cold months, Nodar brings them back to his farm. Nodar sells lambs and dairy products, as well as wool. He sells these products locally to retailers. Along with the above-mentioned, Nodar grows watermelons and melons on a family-owned plot of land. He sells harvested products to greengrocery retailers.
