At this time, Marina is requesting a loan to buy more tables for her restaurant, as well as to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, sugar and oil. Marina would like to continue expanding her restaurant, and hopes to see all her children working as professionals. She is grateful for the loan, as her continued business success allows her to pay for the cost of university tuition and school supplies for her children.

Marina is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy tables and cooking ingredients such as rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is a 54-year-old farmer from a small village in the Kvareli District, East Georgia. Zakaria is married and lives with his wife, Leila, and two adult children (24 and 20 years old). All family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is the only source of the income for them. In particular, the family has a farm with three milk cows, six calves and 47 goats. 

Zakaria and his wife produce various dairy products, mainly yogurt and cheese. They sell milk and other dairy products to local dairy products retailers. Along with the above mentioned, the family owns a greenhouse where cucumber is grown. Zakaria sells harvested products locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 GEL. 

Zakaria requested credit for financing seasonal work in the greenhouse. In particular, he will purchase fertilizers and seeds for cucumbers. The remaining amount will be enough for purchasing two more calves. Zakaria will grow the calves and sell them after six months for higher price. It will give additional income to the family. Zakaria plans to use the increased income for renovation of the house, which is old and needs renovation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and calves.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 58 years old and married. She has five daughters and one son, who are now all working as professionals and living independently. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, flour, milk and cookies. She has had this business for about three years and typically works from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM. Previously, she sold artisanal products around the streets of Cusco.

Carmen is asking for a loan to purchase more products for her grocery store, such as sugar, rice, vegetables and chicken. Carmen hopes to grow her business and eventually move to a larger storefront.

Carmen is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise such as sugar, rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Katina Sarita

texts.es: Katina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II, tiene 32 años, es madre de un niño, es dueña de un locutorio, a ella le encanta el ahorro, esta casada y su esposo ya terminó de estudiar Estomatología y ahora el proyecto que tiene es abrir un consultorio dental, este préstamo es para poder comprar una unidad dental.
texts.en: Katina is a member of the 'Unión II' community bank.  She is 32 years old and the mother of one child.  She owns a 'locutorio' (a business which provides telephone booths where people can pay to make calls).  She loves the savings.  Katina is married and her husband has just finished a degree in stomatology (a medical discipline involving the study of the mouth and its diseases).  Katina's current project is to open a dentist's office.  She will use this loan to buy a dental unit.

loans.use: to buy a dental unit

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and lives with her partner. Recently, she started a new job as a primary school teacher leading a third grade class. Previously, she worked for the Ministry of Health in Peru which administers social security services.

Maria has been investing in her house over the past year, using prior Kiva loans in order to add a new layer of paint, buy new furniture and appliances, and make general improvements to the aging interior. She is very proud of her home and continues to invest in her property. 

Specifically, she would like to construct a studio in her home so that she and her partner can develop a business producing and selling melamine furniture (melamine is a plastic compound). With her loan, Maria plans to buy melamine for her furniture business, as well as home improvement materials such as iron, nails, tubes, cement and tiles. 

Maria hopes to complete construction of the furniture studio soon so that she can launch the business, and little by little save enough money to buy a car.

Maria is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy melamine and home improvement materials such as iron, cement, and tiles.

loans.name: Americo

texts.en:
Americo has dedicated about 18 years to working in transportation services. At various times, he has operated a taxi or heavy transit vehicle carrying freight or passengers. Currently, he is a taxi driver working seven days a week within the city of Cusco. He used to rent a car but was able to buy his own car in recent years, with help from prior Kiva loans. However, his vehicle will be 15 years old next year, at which time he must change vehicles to comply with local laws. 

Americo is requesting a loan in order to buy and renovate a used vehicle to continue operating his taxi business. He is 38 years old and lives with his partner and two daughters who are 4 and 14 years old. Americo takes great pride in his job and hopes that his continued success will allow him to continue maintaining his taxi in good condition. He plans routine maintenance every year. In five to six years' time, Americo says that he would like to change jobs and start a business in his house.

Americo is a member of "Los Diamantes" group in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy and renovate another vehicle to replace his current taxi.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is in her late 60s and married with eight children. Most of her children are now living independently, although two of them are university students studying accounting and nursing. Juana has been in the business of selling for many years. She used to sell food in the market, and at one time she sold firewood. 

Now she owns a small grocery store. She has been running the store in its current location for about 2-3 years. She looks after her store and usually wakes up at 5 in the morning to wait for fresh bread and clean up around the store. She makes her breakfast, opens the store, makes sure everything is in order and starts her day. She closes the store at 10 pm and on Sundays, she rests.

Juana is requesting a loan in order to buy grocery merchandise such as sugar, rice and oil. In the future, she hopes that her children will finish their studies and find good jobs. She is dedicated to her business and wishes to continue running her store and selling merchandise for as long as she is able.

Juana is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy grocery staples such as sugar, rice and oil.

loans.name: Cleofe Eufemia

texts.en:
Cleofe Eufemia and her husband run a business producing and selling caskets elaborated from wood. Together, they have owned this studio for about 10 years. 

With this loan, Cleofe Eufemia plans to purchase wood. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open a funerary home as well as a storefront to display and sell caskets to the public. 

Cleofe Eufemia and her husband are raising two children, ages 4 and 9. She has used prior Kiva loans to invest in tools for her husband’s carpentry work, among other activities.

Cleofe Eufemia is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy wood in order to produce caskets.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter owns a metal workshop, where he produces all sorts of metal products such as doors, roofs, windows and stairs. He is 31 years old and single and has been working in this trade for ten years. 

Walter is requesting a loan in order to purchase machinery such as a solder and a drill. Further into the future, Walter aspires to continue growing his business and add a rolling machine to his inventory of equipment, so that he can offer rolled iron products.

Walter is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy machinery such as a metal solder and a drill.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with one child. 

Gina has a snack and ice vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this work.  

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
 
Gina has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Gina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana María, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo para ganarse la vida y el sustento diario, hace mas de 10 años y con sus pocos recursos que tenia puso en su casa una pequeña tienda de comestibles, la misma que empezó con muy poco y ahora gracias a los créditos ha podido ir aumentando y surtiendo con el paso de los días, en la actualidad además de víveres también vende útiles escolares y ciertos productos de bazar.  Trabajan todos los días  desde las  6h00 hasta las 20h00, en temporadas sus ventas aumentan mucho y en otras no tanto pero igual les produce algo para mantenerse ya que ellos ya están muy ancianos y es así como se ganan el sustento diario.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos para aumentar su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, carnes, pescado y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener una tienda mucho más grande y salud sobre todo para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet in a place called Los Arenales, in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

This is where we meet Ana María.  She is 63 years old, married, and has four children who are all now grown up and independent.  Her husband is a shopkeeper.

More than ten years ago, in order to earn a living and provide for their family on a daily basis, Ana María and her husband used a small amount of money they had to set up a small grocery store in their home.  They started out with very little but now, thanks to loans, they have been able to expand the business and, as time has gone by, they have also added school supplies and some homeware products.  Ana María and her husband work every day, from 6.00am to 8.00pm.  In some seasons their sales increase a lot but in others not so much.  However, all the same, it makes them enough to support themselves.  They are already elderly and this is how they provide for themselves.

Ana María would like to invest this loan in buying more products so that she can grow her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, meat, fish and other basic household products.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because of how easy it is to obtain loans.

Ana María's dreams are to have a much larger store and for herself and her family to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, meat, fish and other basic household products

loans.name: Margot

texts.en:
Margot has a shop where she sews and sells curtains made to order for her customers. Her clients include both institutions and individuals. She learned how to sew while growing up and has been making curtains for about 16 years now. She is 40 years old and is raising two children, 14 and 18 years old, with her partner. 

Margot would like a loan in order to purchase fabric and other materials to produce curtains. Her dream is to own a curtain factory and sell her products at wholesale.

Margot is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make curtains.

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is a 27-year-old biology student at the local university. Upon graduation, she would like to work at a research lab focusing on molecular biology. She says that she is fascinated by science because science holds the answers to many questions; for example, an understanding of DNA has solved many mysteries with respect to heredity and biological development. 

Karina is requesting a loan in order to buy a laptop to aid in her studies. Additionally, she will use part of the loan to help her mother who has a street cart where she sells candy and snacks. Karina hopes to eventually earn a master's degree in molecular biology. She has used her previous Kiva loans in order to invest in micro-businesses to finance her education.

Karina is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for college and purchase sweets for a street cart.

loans.name: Edcie

texts.en:
Edcie is 40 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.

Edcie has a store where she sells groceries and other items. She has operated this business for two years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her grocery store.

Edcie has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Edcie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and products for her grocery store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 40 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Lilia has a grocery store where she sells groceries and other items. She has operated this business for three years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her grocery store.

Lilia became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods and products for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Elezabeth

texts.en:
Elezabeth is 51 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela. Elezabeth is married with five children.

To earn a living, Elezabeth has a business of selling fish in her local community. Elezabeth earns approximately 2,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Elezabeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Elezabeth has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Elezabeth would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Lowell

texts.en:
Lowell is 29 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is married with no children or dependents.

Lowell has a coconut- and copra-buying/selling business. He typically earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to be used for purchasing additional coconuts and copra.

Lowell became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Lowell hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts and copra

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es: María Margarita, es  miembro del Grupo Solidario Las Marías, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hija de cuatro años, su esposo es comerciante. María hace algunos años regreso de Estados Unidos de América y  trajo consigo algunos ahorros para iniciar un negocio y para poder comprar su casa, y con el poco  capital que tenia pudo iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  nueva y usada, su ventaja es que tiene muchos clientes y le va muy bien. El préstamo que María solicita lo invertirá en la compra de blusas, camisas y pantalones, sobretodo estilos que estén de moda, llamando la atención de sus clientes, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Uno de sus sueños era comprar una pequeña casa, la cual con mucho trabajo lo ha logrado junto con su esposo. Su meta es obtener su propio local y que sea un lugar amplio para poder tener su tienda de ropa. Es su primer crédito en FAMA y espera pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Margarita is a member of the Las Marías communal bank.  She is 29 years old, married, and has a four year old daughter.  Her husband is a merchant.

Some years ago María returned from the United States.  She brought with her some savings to start a business and to be able to buy a house.  With the small amount of capital that she had she was able to start a small business selling clothes.  She currently devotes herself to selling new and used clothes.  Her advantage is that she has a lot of customers, and it is going very well for her.

María will use the loan that she is requesting to buy blouses, shirts, pants, and above all, styles that are in fashion.  This will get the attention of her customers, and she will then be able to increase her sales.  

One of her dreams was to buy a small house.  With a great deal of work she managed to do this together with her husband.  Her goal is to get her own place.  She wants the place to be large enough to be able to have a clothing store.

This is her first loan with Fama, and she plans on making her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is in her 50s, widowed and lives with her 24-year-old son. Esther has spent most of her life preparing tamales, a traditional Peruvian food made of corn meal wrapped in corn leaves. She makes both sweet and savory varieties, and sells her tamales in the street. 

Esther is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients such as maize, sugar, and corn leaves. Her dream is to build up her savings and buy a plot of land. 

In the past, Esther has held other occupations, such as selling breakfast food and artisanal crafts.

Esther is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy maize, sugar, and corn leaves to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Alicia Group

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and lives in P-2 Pan-ay Diot, Tudela. Alicia is married with four children.

To earn a living, Alicia works in the fish industry by selling fish in her community. Alicia has been in this line of business for two years. Alicia is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional dried fish to sell to her customers.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her business.

Alicia is the leader of a four-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group operates her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Marly

texts.en:
Marly is 40 years old and lives in Pob. 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Marly is married with four children.

To earn a living, Marly has a store where she sells a variety of products. Marly has operated this business for two years. Marly is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents, that she could then sell to her customers.

Marly has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Marly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products (including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents)

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 43 years old and lives in Pob. 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Wilma is single with three children.

To earn a living, Wilma has a store where she sells a variety of products. Wilma has operated this business for two years. Wilma is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as gasoline and firewood.

Wilma has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Wilma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell (including gasoline and firewood)

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II, tiene 44 años, es dueña de un Centro de Computo, ella es casada, ahora esta pasando por una etapa no tan buena económicamente, lo que esta tratando es de gastar en lo primordial, hasta que pueda pasar este tiempo, ella aprendió mucho en Finca como la forma de salir adelante a pesar de los obstáculos, las capacitaciones ayudaron mucho. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de tinta e insumos para recargar tonner.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Unión II communal bank.  She is 44 years old, and she is the owner of a computer center.  She is married.

She is now going through a difficult stage financially.  What she is trying to do is to spend on what is essential until she can get through this time.

She learned a lot in Finca.  She learned how to get ahead in spite of the obstacles, and the trainings helped a lot.

She will now use the loan to buy ink and supplies to refill toner.

loans.use: to buy ink and supplies to refill toner.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 42 years old and lives in P-2 Locsoon, Tudela. Dina is married with two children.

To earn a living, Dina works as a farmer by growing and selling vegetables. Dina has been doing this for two years. Dina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers.

Dina has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Dina hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Russel Ann

texts.en:
Russel Ann is 32 years old and lives in Pob. 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Russel Ann is married with no children.

Russel Ann has a store where she sells variety of products. Russel Ann has operated this business for four years. Russel Ann is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to re-sell to her customers, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

Russel Ann has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Russel Ann hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to re-sell (including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents)

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 36 years old and lives in Pob. 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Melchora is a widow with three children.

Melchora has a beauty parlor business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Melchora is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional beauty products.

Melchora has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Melchora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, vice  représentante du groupe de crédit Shukrani, femme dynamique, ambitieuse, entrepreneur, âgée de 52 ans, mariée. Elle est  vendeuses des habits. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour démarrer ses affaires.  Son mari est un pasteur  évangéliste serviteur dans une communauté protestante. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  3eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  une dizaine des boubous dames.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et ouvrir ses horizons pour s’approvisionner à Kampala.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is vice representative of the Shukrani credit group. She is an entrepreneur, a dynamic woman, ambitious, 52 years old, and married. She sells clothing.

She began her business when she found out about the microcredit that was offered by the MFI, Hekima. Thus, she received her first loan of $50 to start up her business. Her husband is an evangelist pastor serving in a protestant community. The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and the education of her children.

Meanwhile, she has just received her third loan. Since receiving her first loan, her business has grown. So, she decided to increase the amount of her loan for this cycle. She will use this new loan to buy about ten female boubous. Also, she hopes to broaden her horizons and stock up in Kampala, as well as see her children grow up. The client would like to thank Hekima for helping to give autonomy to poor women who to not have access to classic banking.

loans.use: to buy about ten female boubous

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Elsa Mariflor

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos ya todos mayores de edad, pero el menor de ellos  aun vive con ella. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella tiene un negocio de compra y ventas de pinchaguas, esta es una variedad de pez muy solicitada por las personas y por los dueños de negocios de ceviches, ya que con este producto ellos preparan el delicioso ceviche de pinchaguas que es muy apreciado  por los clientes, ella compra a los pescadores en Los  Arenales, de allí se encarga de limpiar el pescado y curtirlas en  limón para luego entregarlas en tarrinas plásticas a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días en las mañanas tanto en la limpieza como en la entrega de sus productos, lleva más de cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad que le deja muy buenos ingresos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más pinchaguas (pescado) y embases plásticos. Nuestra amiga lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es como una gran familia.
  
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton, in a place known as 'Los Arenales'. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its wonderful food and the warmth of its people.

This is the place where 52 year old Elsa lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have four grown children.  However, the youngest child still lives with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She has a business of buying and selling “pinchaguas”.  This is a type of fish that is much demand by individuals and by owners of “ceviche” (a dish made of raw fresh fish cooked by lots of lemon juice) businesses.  They use her product to prepare delicious “ceviche de pinchaguas”, which her customers really enjoy.

She buys from the fisherman in Los Arenales.  From there she takes charge of cleaning the fish and marinates them in lemon.  She later delivers them in plastic containers to her customers.  She works every day in the mornings, and she works as much on cleaning as delivering her products.  She has been engaged in this business activity, which leaves her very good earnings, for over five years.

This loan is to buy more pinchaguas and plastic containers.  Our friend has been in the communal bank for over two years.  She likes it because the group is like a big family.

Her dreams are to get ahead and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy more pinchaguas (fish) and plastic containers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II, tiene 57 años, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, es madre de 3 hijos, esta separada, en Finca ella aprendió a ahorrar, a ser mas responsable y esos valores para una mujer sola son muy importantes ya que esta criando a sus hijos, todo lo que aprende lo transmite a sus hijos, su negocio esta prosperando y eso es lo que siempre deseaba, esta muy contenta por todo lo que esta logrando, también aprendió a valorarse. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en: Juana is a member of the Union Community Bank. She is 57 years old and has a small grocery store. She is a mother with three children. She is separated from her husband. She learned how to save money and be very responsible from Finca. These are very important values for a single woman. She is raising her children and everything that she learns she teaches to her children. Her business is prosperous. This is what she has always desired. She is very happy about everything that she has achieved. She has learned to value this. She will buy grocery supplies for her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 44 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. She is married with 2 children. Marilou works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Marilou has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional fishing materials such as a fishing net, etc.. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Marilou hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials such as a fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Reina

texts.en: Reina is married with 2 children. She is 46 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. Reina is a farmer and grows livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Reina has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional feed. She has been a member of PMPC for 9 months. In the future, Reina hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Mahugnon 5 Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON 5 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à la même famille. La représentante du groupe, Ségbégnon (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Ségbégnon est mariée à un certain Félix. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous sont à leur charge. Ségbégnon  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Ségbégnon a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, puis a appris la couture. Il y a environs huit ans que Ségbégnon exerce cette activité de couture, qui lui permet de faire face à ses différentes charges. Parallèlement à cette activité, Ségbégnon vend des fournitures de couture et des chaussures dans une ville du Bénin. Ségbégnon s’approvisionne au Bénin et parfois à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'élargir son activité, Ségbégnon sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON 5. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHUGNON 5 is a group of three people who are all members of the same family. The group's representative, Ségbégnon (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 37 years old. Ségbégnon is married to a man named Félix. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school. All of the couple's children are in their care. Ségbégnon lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together.

Ségbégnon stopped her studies at the primary school level, then learned to sew. She has been sewing as a business for about eight years now, which allows her to cover her various expenses. On the side, Ségbégnon sells sewing supplies and shoes in a town in Benin. Ségbégnon stocks up in Benin and sometimes in Lomé.

Striving to satisfy her customers and grow her business, Ségbégnon, along with the other members of the MAHUGNON 5 group, is seeking a sixth loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to better meet the demand from their customers and make more profit. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and shoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth Milagros

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es madre de un pequeño de 3 añitos al cual adora mucho, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor e cualquier época del año, asimismo es muy conocido por sus riquísimos camarones, así como también por sus agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz. En su tiempo libre a Elizabeth gusta jugar vóley y salir a correr ya que la relaja y la distrae cuando esta de mal humor, su platillo favorito es el riquísimo arroz tapada y si es arroz de cama mejor nos comenta Elizabeth; debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, por ello ella trabaja de sol a sol para salir adelante y sobre todo darle un buen futuro a su hijo.

Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora, de lunes a sábado trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y los días domingos vende salchipollo y salchipapas en la feria que se realiza en su ciudad, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y trabajadora y sobre todo porque atiende de manera amable a sus clientes.

Elizabeth agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de Ropa ( ropa de temporada de otoño), lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y seguir luchando cada día por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su local propio”.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, a hardworking and enthusiastic woman, is the mother of a 3-year-old whom she adores. Her home is located in Camana, a city whose climate is warm and welcoming throughout the year. It is also well known for its delicious shrimps and for agriculture, especially the cultivation of rice. In her free time, Elizabeth likes to play volleyball or go for a run, which relaxes and distracts her when she is in a bad mood. Elizabeth tell us that her favorite dish is molded rice, and even better if it is rice with seafood. As her parents had few financial resources, she only attended high school through the fifth level. 

She works from sunrise to sunset to get ahead and provide a bright future for her son. Elizabeth is a very hardworking woman who operates her retail clothing business from Mondays to Saturdays. On Sundays she sells fried chicken and fried potatoes with hot dogs at the city's market. She believes her business is doing well because she is responsible and hardworking and, most of all, because she graciously attends to her customers.

Elizabeth is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support that they have offered her, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her clothing business (clothing for the fall season). This will allow her to offer a wider variety of items and keep fighting every day to realize her greatest dream: "To have my own shop."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (winter clothing)

loans.name: 14 De Febrero Group

texts.es: Ricarda es miembro del Grupo Solidario 14 de Febrero, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijas, las cuales le ayudan económicamente, son buenas hijas, responsables y trabajadoras. El negocio lo aprendió  de su madre desde hace 20 años y actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y ropa interior. Su horario de atención inicia por las mañanas de 7:00 a.m y culmina como a las 6:00 p.m. Ricarda gracias a Dios es una persona sana, muy jovial, amable y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Ella solicita este préstamo para comprar ropa nueva y así surtir su negocio de estilos actuales y acordes a la temporada de verano. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá llamar la atención de más clientes y seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir sus gastos. Su sueño es tener un local propio y surtir bien su negocio. Este es el segundo financiamiento que obtiene Ricarda en FAMA y hasta el momento ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Ricarda is a member of the “Fourteenth of February” Solidarity Group. She is 44 years old and a single mother with two children who help her economically. They are good girls, responsible and hardworking. The business that they learned from their mother, twenty years ago, is the sales of new clothes and underclothes. They work from 7:00am until 6:00 pm. Ricarda, thanks to God, is healthy, cheerful, friendly and well known among her neighbors. She is asking for this loan to buy new clothes in order to have a greater inventory of new clothing styles and summer clothes for the coming summer season. With the help of this loan she can attract more customers and continue with this economic activity that allows her to cover her expenses. Her dream is to have a permanent location and a larger variety of goods for her business. This is the second loan that Ricarda has received from FAMA. Up to now she has been punctual with her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underclothes and other items.

loans.name: Elsa Carmen

texts.es: Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II,es socia de Finca hace 16 años, es dueña de una casa de 4 pisos y alquila cuartos, ella pudo construir su casa con la ayuda de los prestamos que ha ido recibiendo, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, le encanta las capitaciones por que le ayudan a poder sobrellevar las dificultades que tienen con su enfermedad, ella sufre de Artrosis, esta muy contenta porque puede ser mejor persona en su casa como en su negocio, todos los logros que tiene fue gracias a la ayuda de Finca, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá  para la mejora de uno de los cuartos.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the "Union II" Communal Bank, and has been associated with Fina for some 16 years. She owns a 4-story house and rents out rooms. Elsa was able to construct her house with the help of loans she has received. She also sells beauty products. 

Elsa is enchanted with Finca's training sessions because they help her overcome the difficulties she has with her illness. She suffers from degenerative osteoarthritis. Elsa is very content because now she can be a better person in her home and in her business. All her achievements have been thanks to the aid of Finca. 

Now, with this loan, she will invest in improving one of her rental rooms.

loans.use: to complete a room in her house to be rented.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 50 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married with 3 children. Regina has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 1 year. Regina requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.. Regina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en: Alan is married with 10 children. He is 50 years old and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela. Alan is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living.  He has been doing this for 10 years. Alan has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial fertilizers. He has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Alan hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial fertilizers

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is 31 years old and lives in Nailon, Tudela. She is married with 1 child. Leah has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 4 years. Leah requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.. Leah has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Luz Paulina

texts.es:
Luz Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, está separada y tiene dos hijas. La señora estudio solo hasta la secundaria.
 
Trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio venta de granos de la región, también se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como chanchos y ovinos.

Con su nuevo préstamo solicitado de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles comprará ocho chanchos para su respectivo engorde y venderlos en las fiestas. 

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener su casa y mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las capacitaciones


En la foto se muestra junto a una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Luz Paulina is a member of the “Women of Santa Rosa de Arapa II” Community Bank. . It is located in the Arapa District, in the Azángaro Province, in the department of Puno.
She is 29 years old, separated and has two children. She has a secondary education.
She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past two years. Her first loan was for 500.00 new soles, a loan, which she used in her business selling local grains. She also buys and sells animals such as pigs and sheep.
With this new loan that she is requesting, for 1,000.00 new soles, she will buy eight pigs that she will fatten up and sell for the holidays. Her future dreams are to have her own house and improve her business. What she likes the most about the community bank are their meetings and their capacity building. In this photo you see her with one of her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy eight pigs to fatten them up for sales.

loans.name: Evarista Julia

texts.es:
Evarista es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Con cinco hijos, la señora estudio educación secundaria incompleta.
 
Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de animales, trabaja hace dos años con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, también la señora se dedica a la venta de terrenos.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará terrenos para construirlo y luego venderlos en la mina, su esposo trabaja en la mina rinconada. 

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener un camión para llevar mercaderías a la mina.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad, responsabilidad y las charlas.
texts.en:
Evarista is a member of the “Women of Santa Rosa de Arapa II” Community Bank. . It is located in the Arapa District, in the Azángaro Province, in the department of Puno. She is 32 years old, has a partner and five children. She did not complete her secondary education.
Her first loan was for 500.00 new soles. She used this money in her business of selling animals. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past two years. She also sells land.
With this new loan, of 2,000.00 new soles, she will buy land in order to build on it and sell it in this mining community. Her husband works in the Rinconada mine. Her dream for the future is to have a truck in order to bring merchandise to the mine. What she likes the most about the community bank is the punctuality, responsibility and the lectures.

loans.use: to buy land in order to build on it and sell it to the mine.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид житель района Кубодиен. Ему 55 лет Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его дети находятся на заработках заграницей. Сам он занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа телят и корма для скота.
texts.en: Abdurashid is a resident of the Qubadiyon district.  He is 55 years old, married and has four children.  His children are all working abroad.  Abdurashid is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves and livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy calves and livestock feed

loans.name: Gulistan

texts.ru: Гулистан жительница района Кубодиен. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Гулистан имеет среднее образование. Она более 7 лет занимается скотоводством. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Gulistan is a resident of the Qubadiyon district.  She is 39 years old, married and has six children.  Gulistan has a secondary education.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over seven years.  She is requesting this loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб житель района Шахритус. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он вместе со всей семьей занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Сухроб имеет высшее образование. Он по профессии учитель. В этой области Сухроб работает десять лет. Он берет кредит для посева пшеницы, картошки и других видов овощей.
texts.en: Suhrob is a resident of the Shahrituz district.  He is 36 years old, married and has three children.  Together with his family, he is involved in sowing agricultural crops.  Suhrob has a higher education.  He is a teacher and has been working in this field for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to sow wheat, potatoes and other types of vegetables.

loans.use: to sow wheat, potatoes and other types of vegetables

loans.name: Khurram

texts.ru: Хуррам проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Хуррам занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет кредит для закупа семян овощей.
texts.en: Khurram lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 37 years old, married and has three children.  Khurram is involved in agriculture.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to buy vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Acari”  ubicado en el distrito, provincia  Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  Realizó estudios de educación secundaria.
 
La señora Alicia es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizará para comprar un saco de ají, orégano, la señora vende sus productos en Desaguadero.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener su casa y carro para el servicio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es  la facilidad del préstamo
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the “Santa Cruz of Acari” Community Bank. It is located in the provincial district of Yunguyo in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, single and has a child. She has finished her secondary education.
Alicia is a new member who recently began working with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She is asking for this loan, of 1,000.00 new soles, which she will use to buy bags of peppers and oregano. She sells these products in Desaguadero.
Her dreams for the future are to have her own house and a car for her business.
What she likes the most about the community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of pepper and oregano.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija pequeña, realizó estudios de educación superior tècnica.
 
Trabaja desde hace año y medio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar una mesa para la máquina de cocer ya que la señora se dedica a confeccionar ternos y arreglos de prendas en general.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar una mesa grande para cortar telas y una maquina semi industrial para la confección de sus ternos, trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en albañil. 

Su sueño para el futuro  es agrandar la empresa y poner una heladería.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las capacitaciones, las charlas y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank “Women of Santa Rosa of Arapa II,” located in the district of Arapa, Azángaro province, Department of Puno. She is 31 years old, a live-in partner, and has a young daughter. She started technical university courses. 
 
For a year and a half, she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, money which she used to buy a table for her sewing machine, as she makes suits and mends other garments. 

She is requesting a new loan of S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, money which she will use to buy a large table for cutting fabric and a semi-industrial machine for making suits. She works alone; her husband is a construction worker.

Her dream is to expand her business and open an ice cream shop in the future. What she likes most about her communal bank are the training, discussions, and the credit facilities.

loans.use: to buy a large table for cutting fabric and a semi-industrial machine for making suits.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Acari”  ubicado en el distrito, provincia  Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos en estudios.
La señora cuenta con estudios de educación primaria.
 
Trabaja desde hace ocho años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes, también la señora se dedica a la venta de ají.

En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero con la que comprará azúcar, arroz y leche, trabaja sola en el negocio su esposo trabaja en el sector de educación.

Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir operando en el negocio y mejorarlo.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a member of the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Acari," located in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno.  She is 42 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school.

Lucrecia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 8 years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in her grocery store.  Lucrecia also has a business selling chili peppers.

At this time, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 300 Peruvian soles to purchase sugar, rice and milk.  She works by herself in her business; her husband works in education.

Lucrecia's dream for the future is to continue to operate her business and improve it.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the easy payment terms on the loans, and the savings accounts.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and milk

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 59 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. She works in the fish industry, selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years, and has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for seven years and hopes, in the future, to purchase a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 23-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. His wife works as a manicurist.

Henry provides vulcanizing services to his community. He has had this business for two years. Henry does not have his own shop yet. People in his community calls for his service whenever they need him. Henry works hard to improve his business and save for the future. 

Henry said he joined CEVI because he needs additional capital for his business. He plans to use his loan to purchase tools and gasoline. 

Henry hopes to have his own space for a vulcanizing shop soon.

loans.use: to purchase tools and gasoline.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel has been in the business of raising hogs for 5 years. She earns 3000 PHP per month with her business. Raquel is able to help pay for her family's basic needs with her income. She works hard to improve her business and save more for the future.

Raquel requested a loan to purchase pig feeds and vitamins. She hopes to continue earning through raising pigs. Raquel has 7 children aged between 1 and 20 and she hopes for all of them to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: buy pig feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Acari”  ubicado en el distrito, provincia  Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, realizo estudios de educación secundaria.
 
La señora Yaneth trabaja hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de llicllas (telas).

Yaneth solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,200.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizara para comprar cincuenta unidades de llicllas, estos lo vende en la localidad de Juliaca, su esposo trabaja realizando servicios de costura.

Su sueño para el futuro  es viajar con la mercadería a otros lugares y generar mayores ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones, la puntualidad, el ahorro y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the “Santa Cruz de Acari” Communal Bank, in the Yunguyo province of the department of Puno. She’s 26 years old, finished junior high school and has a partner and one child.
Yaneth has been working with Movimiento Manuel Ramos for two years. Her 1st loan was for 500 soles, which she invested in the purchase of llicllas (traditional fabric made into a shall or to carry babies).
Yaneth is requesting a new loan for 1,200 soles, which she will use to buy 50 units of llicllas in the town of Juliaca, where her husband offers his services as a tailor. 
Her dream for the future is to travel to other areas with her merchandise to generate more income. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the meetings, punctuality, savings and income.

loans.use: buy 50 units of llicllas (traditional fabric made into a shall or to carry babies).

loans.name: Lourdes Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lourdes, dedicada a la educacion de sus hijos, con metas a futuro, manifiesta sentirse muy afortunada de contar con dos fuentes de ingresos las cuales han sido el sosten para ella poder bindarle lo mejor a su familia; agradece el apoyo incondicional de parte de Afodenic que en momentos mas dificiles le han sabido responder a sus solicitudes de credito. Lo que se proyecta con esta nueva oportunidad de confianza dada a su persona, es invertirlo en su pulperia, realizando de esta manera compras varias que le ayudaran a incrementar su inventario de su negocio y a la vez su clientela. Su mayor deseo es convertir su negocio en una miscelania de manera que pueda dia a dia brindarle a sus hijos mejor nivel de vida, en particular a su hija menor la cual desea verla convertirda en toda una profesional por lo que se encuentra en la universidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes is dedicated to her children’s education with goals for the future.  She states that she feels very fortunate to have two sources of income that have been her support to provide the best for her family.  She is grateful for Afodenic’s unconditional support which in her most difficult moments has responded.

What she’s proposing with this new occasion of trust in her is to invest in her grocery store; she will make several purchases that will help her increase inventory in her store and clientele as well.  Her greatest wish is to turn her store into a variety store so that every day she can provide her children with a better standard of living, especially her youngest daughter who she wants to see become a complete professional who to do so is attending university.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en: Nelda is 46 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban. She is married, has four children and earns a living by running a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has had this business for four years and is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents. Nelda has been a member of PMPC for three years and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is 48 years old and lives in Senior, Sinacaban. She is a widow, has one child and earns a living by running a general store where she sells variety of products. She has had this business for seven years and is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy additional products to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents. Andresa has been a member of PMPC for seven years and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose B. caballero de 41 años de edad, casado, y responsable. Se mantiene con su trabajo de recamarero en uno de los hoteles de la capital. Asegura el señor que a traves de los financiamientos otorgados por Afodenic y con sus esfuerzos de parte de su esposa y el; es como han podido verle avances a la infraestructura de su vivienda. Con este credito lo que se proyecta es la mejora a la parte de cocina y baño de su hogar y para ello necesitara comprar materiales de construccion tales como: cemento, hierro, bloques, piedrin y otros. Hoy en dia Don Jose expresa sentirse muy conteto por las metas alcanzadas en lo que corresponde a la construccion de su vivienda ya  que una mejor habitad les dará a su esposa y su pequeña hija mejores niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, age 41, is married and a responsible gentleman. He continues in his job with the housekeeping department at one of the hotels in the capital. Jose has secured himself using the loans provided by AFODENIC. Through his own efforts and those of his wife, they have been able to make improvements to the infrastructure of their home.

With this loan, Jose proposes to improve part of the kitchen and bathroom in his home. In order to do this, he needs to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, gravel, and other supplies. Don Jose now says that he is very content with the goals he has accomplished in terms of the construction of his house, which will provide his wife and young daughter a better environment and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for making improvements to the bathroom and kitchen in his home.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Acari”  ubicado en el distrito, provincia  Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 75 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos independientes.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
 
Margarita trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/. 2,500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar mercaderías como chompas, llicllas (telas), mantones, mandiles, etc., en el negocio le ayuda sus hijos, la mercadería la vende en las ferias de la localidad.

Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir operando en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  la facilidad del préstamo
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the “Santa Cruz de Acari” Communal Bank, in the Yunguyo province of the department of Puno. She’s a 75 year old married mother of children who are now independent. She has no schooling.

Margarita has been working with Movimiento Manuel Ramos for six years. Her 1st loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in her clothing sales business.

Margarita is requesting a new loan for 2,500 soles, which she will use to buy merchandise like, sweaters, llicllas (traditional fabric used to carry babies), shawls, aprons, etc. Her children help her with the business. She sells her merchandise at the local fairs.

Her dream for the future is to continue operating her business and improving her income. What she likes most about the Communal Bank is how easy it is to get a loan.

loans.use: buy sweaters, llicllas (traditional fabric used to carry babies), shawls, aprons, etc.
